April 2020

1 April 2020

  • Yong, Ed: Everyone Thinks They’re Right About Masks, The Atlantic, 01.04.2020.
  • Klare Kante für die Demokratie, Die Humanisten, 01.04.2020.
  • Top U.S. & World Headlines — April 1, 2020 (Democracy Now! on YouTube, 15 minutes, 01.04.2020).
  • Trump Backed Off Virus Timeline After His Poll Numbers Tanked (The Ring of Fire on YouTube, 4 minutes, 01.04.2020).
    Trump changed his mind about re-opening the country on Easter Sunday after poll showed that the people don't support this and that it would harm his re-election chances.
  • Johnson, Jake: McConnell Draws Outrage for 'Ridiculous' Excuse That Trump Impeachment Trial Prevented Action on Coronavirus Crisis, Common Dreams, 01.04.2020.
  • Binkley, Collin: Remote learning poses hurdles for students with disabilities, ABC News, 01.04.2020.
  • Coronavirus is not the flu. It's worse. (Vox on YouTube, 6 minutes, 01.04.2020).
    This video explains a number of important differences beteween influenza and Covid-19. First, the basic reproduction number (R0) for influenza is 1.3, whereas for Covid-19 it is 2–2.5 (for measles, it is 12–18), which makes a huge difference after, for example, 10 rounds of infections (56 versus 2047, respectively). Second, the incubation periods are very different: 2 days for influenza versus 5 to 14 days for Covid-19. So someone who has been infected will infect many more other people before they start feeling sick. Third, there always a number people who are immune to the seasonal flu, either because they have already had that strain of the virus or because they have had a flu shot. This limits the spread of the virus. The SARS-CoV-2 virus is new, so nobody is immune and everyone is susceptible. In addition, only 2% infected by the flu virus need to be hospitalised, whereas 20 to 31% of people with Covid-19 end up in hospital. Covid-19's fatality rate might be between 1% and 3% (this is still uncertain) but for flu it is 0.1%. However, for elderly people and people with a compromised immunity, Covid-19's fatality rate is much higher. This is why social distancing is very important.
  • Polychroniou, C. J.: Chomsky: Ventilator Shortage Exposes the Cruelty of Neoliberal Capitalism, truthout, 01.04.2020.
  • US Losing Superpower Status Over Virus Implosion (David Pakman Show on YouTube, 7 minutes, 01.04.2020).
    After the election of Donald Trump, Western democracies over time stopped involving the USA in talks about climate change and the US president is no longer called the “leader of the free world”. Similarly, other countries are not looking to the USA when trying to figure out how to deal with the pandemic, nor, in spite of what Donald Trump claims, asking the USA for help.
  • Gertz, Matt: While coronavirus spread across the globe, President Trump was busy doing what he always does: Tweeting about Fox News, Media Matters for America, 01.04.2020.
  • Remarks by President Trump, Vice President Pence, and Members of the Coronavirus Task Force in Press Briefing, White House, 01.04.2020.
    Donald Trump was asked whether people should be wearing masks. He responded: A lot of people don’t like it. Some people don’t like it because you’re taking it away from the medical professional. Some people don’t like it for other reasons. I don’t see where it hurts. And it doesn’t have to be a mask; it can be a scarf. A scarf is highly recommended by the professionals. (…) But what I do see people doing now is using scarves. And I think, in a certain way, depending on the fabric — I think, in a certain way, a scarf is better. It’s actually better.
    In response to Trump's statement, the CDC had to update their website to point out that medical professional should use scarves only as a last resort when they run out of face masks. The CDC's webpage Strategies for Optimizing the Supply of Facemasks says, HCP use of homemade masks:
    In settings where facemasks are not available, HCP might use homemade masks (e.g., bandana, scarf) for care of patients with COVID-19 as a last resort. However, homemade masks are not considered PPE, since their capability to protect HCP is unknown. Caution should be exercised when considering this option. Homemade masks should ideally be used in combination with a face shield that covers the entire front (that extends to the chin or below) and sides of the face.
    See also CDC Forced To Correct Trump's Lies About Pandemic (The Ring of Fire on YouTube, 4 minutes, 02.04.2020).
  • COVID-19 : décoder les chiffres | Data Science vs Fake (ARTE on YouTube, 5 minutes, 01.04.2020).
    This video explains why the real number of people infected by SARS-CoV-2 is not known. The reasons include the fact that not all countries use the same criteria for testing people and that testing logistics vary from country to country.
  • Chait, Jonathan: Pence, in Craziest Lie Yet, Denies Trump Ever Downplayed the Coronavirus, Intelligencer / New York Magazine, 01.04.2020.
    Trump downplayed the Covid-19 epidemic for a long time and later had to change his position on some of his earlier statements. Today, when CNN’s Wolf Blitzer asked about those statements, Vice-President Mike Pence said, “I don’t believe the president has ever belittled the threat of the coronavirus.”
  • See Bill Gates’ Chilling Pandemic Warnings To Trump – Before The Coronavirus Outbreak Hit (MSNBC on YouTube, 10 minutes, 01.04.2020.
    A brief overview of the warnings Bill Gates has given in the course of the years, including two meetings with Donald Trump in 2016 and 2018.
  • Werken zorgverleners in België met slechte mondmaskers? (Terzake on YouTube, 5 minutes, 01.04.2020).
    According to doctor Ignace Demeyer of the OLV Hospital in Aalst, pointed out that the FFP2 masks delivered by the Belgian authorities are not reliable; they become leaky after at most 30 minutes. The masks were manufactured in China. Testing reveals that the filter material is of low quality: its filter capacity is insufficiently and it does not fit the face well.
  • CORONA: Masken- und Meinungs-Verordnung. (Mit Biologe Clemens Arvay) (CGArvay on YouTube, 10 minutes, 01.04.2020).
  • Albert Camus - The Plague (The School of Life on YouTube, 10 minutes, 01.04.2020.
    This video is not about the Covid-19 pandemic but explains how Camus' novel is relevant to pandemics in general.
  • Coronavirus: Rubber bullets, batons and bullying mar Africa's shutdowns, The Straits Times, 01.04.2020.
    Quote: Rubber bullets, tear gas and whips have been used to maintain social distancing in shopping queues and to discipline citizens caught outside their homes without valid reason.

2 April 2020

  • Coronavirus: Why death and mortality rates differ, BBC Future, 02.04.2020.

    The far-right German political party AfD does not take the Covid-19 epidemic seriously; AfD politicians have often been seen ignoring social-distancing rules, both inside and outside parliaments. Some example statements: Armin-Paul Hampel: Haben wir vielleicht eine Krise inszeniert? Es ist keine Epidemie wie Pest oder Cholera, sondern eine verhältnismäßig leichte Grippe, die an einem begrenzten Personenkreis, an einer relative kleinen, eine lebensbedrohliche Auswirkung hat. Corinna Miazga: Ich gehöre nicht zu den Leuten, die erzählen, was sie persönlich für richtig halten. (…)

  • Choi, Matthew: Trump suggests wearing a scarf against coronavirus. The CDC isn’t so sure., Politico, 02.04.2020.
    Quote: But the agency specifies that those cloth substitutes cannot be classified as personal protective equipment because “their capability to protect [health care providers] is unknown.” The CDC recommends using additional face guards if health care workers must resort to using bandannas, scarves and other substitutes.
  • Biddle, Sam: Privacy Experts Say Responsible Coronavirus Surveillance Is Possible, The Intercept, 02.04.2020.
  • LaPorta, James; Ackerman, Spencer: Army Warned in Early February That Coronavirus Could Kill 150,000 Americans, Daily Beast, 02.04.2020.
    Quote: An unclassified briefing document on the novel coronavirus prepared on Feb. 3 by U.S. Army-North projected that “between 80,000 and 150,000 could die.” It framed the projection as a “Black Swan” analysis, meaning an outlier event of extreme consequence but often understood as an unlikely one.
  • Gettys, Travis: Army warned Trump administration on Feb. 3 that up to 150,000 Americans could die from COVID-19, Raw Story, 02.04.2020.
    Quote: An unclassified briefing document prepared Feb. 3 U.S. Army-North projected that “between 80,000 and 150,000 could die” in an extreme “Black Swan” analysis, but after weeks of inaction President Donald Trump now concedes optimistically between 100,000 and 240,000 could lose their lives to the virus, reported The Daily Beast.
  • Mazza, Ed: Doctor Drops Some Coronavirus Truth Bombs On Fox News, Lights Up Twitter, HuffPost, 02.04.2020.
    When Martha MacCallum of Fox News repeate Donald Trump's claim that there were supposed to be millions of tests available, Dr. Rishi Desai, chief medical officer of Osmosis.com disagreed. Desai pointed out that the WHO had warned about the virus on 31 December 2019 and that the quick text MacCallum mentioned was still under development. Desai also pointed out that South Korea and the United Statest had their first reported case of Covid-10 on the same day. In South Korea, the mortality rate is only a fraction of what the U.S.A. has because that country had a strong response while the U.S.A. had a weak response. At that point, MacCallum did not ask follow-up questions but ended the interview.
  • Palmer, Ewan: Dr. Desai Trends After Lambasting Trump Admin's 'Weak Response' to Coronavirus Pandemic on Fox News, Newsweek, 02.04.2020.
    See also Fox INSTANTLY Ends Interview With the Wrong Doctor (David Pakman Show on YouTube, 7 minutes, 02.04.2020).
  • Fired Amazon Strike Leader Has Powerful Message (The Jimmy Dore Show on YouTube, 17 minutes, 02.04.2020).
    Jimmy Dores talks with Amazon employee Christian Smalls, who he disagreed with the management decision not to tell warehouse workers that an employee who had tested positive for Covid-19. After he organised a walkout, Amazon fired him.

3 April 2020

  • Tout sur le masque barrière AFNOR, en France et à l’international, AFNOR, 03.04.2020.
    The AFNOR standard Masques barrières, published on 27.03.2020, is now available for free in for language versions: French, English, Spanish and German. See also the website Masques barrières réalisés à partir de l'AFNOR Spec S76-001, a platform where people offering or looking for masks made according to the standard can get into contact with each other.

    Embedded YouTube video with the following description: Mercredi 1er avril, les 650 000 habitants du district de Jia, en Chine, ont été placés en confinement, de peur d'un rebond épidémique. L'entrée dans le pays est désormais interdite aux étrangers.
  • Roy, Arundhati: The pandemic is a portal, Financial Times, 03.04.2020.
    See also the interview Pandemic Is a Portal: Arundhati Roy on COVID-19 in India, Imagining Another World & Fighting for It (Democracy Now! on YouTube, 18 minutes, 16.04.2020).
  • Der Tag: Mexiko stoppt Produktion von Corona-Bier, n-tv.de, 03.04.2020.
  • Barrera, Adriana: The brewing giant behind Corona beer is halting production after its business was deemed nonessential during the pandemic, Business Insider, 03.04.2020.
  • Fact-Checking The Claims Made At Thursday's Coronavirus Briefing - Day That Was (MSNBC on YouTube, 03.04.32020; broadcast on 02.04.2020).
    In the 2 April White House briefing, it was not clear who is actually in charge, the Vice President, Jared Kushner or the admiral who talked about the supply chain. Donald Trump said that the states should handle the epidemic themselves, with the federal government acting as a backup. The states should have had more equipment and PPE already on hand, they should have bought them on the open market before the pandemic. When asked bout the 200,000 masks that were being delivered to New York hospitals, Rear Admiral John Polowczyk said that the masks are actually being distributed to commercial distributers, who will then sell them to the highest bidder, including bidders outside the U.S.A.. He said, That's normally how things work. I'm not here to disrupt a supply chain. In fact, “disrupting the supply chain” is exactly what needs to happen, as in the case of war. and is what the governors and the hospitals are asking for. In addition, states where the governors have aligned themselves with Donald Trump get whatever they want.
  • As Virus Spreads in Philippines, So Does Authoritarianism: Duterte Threatens Violence Amid Lockdown (Democracy Now! on YouTube, 10 minutes, 03.04.2020).
    Quote from the description below the video: In the Philippines, authoritarian President Rodrigo Duterte said Wednesday he’s ordered soldiers to shoot to kill residents if they resist a strict lockdown on the island of Luzon. His order came after residents of Manila’s Quezon City shanty town staged a protest, saying they’ve gone hungry without food promised when the lockdown began more than two weeks ago.

4 April 2020

  • Rummler, Orion: NYT: Nearly 40k flew to U.S. from China after Trump's coronavirus travel ban, Axios, 04.04.2020.

    See MSNBC on Twitter, 04.04.2020: If you are a president who has declared a national emergency you thereby accept national responsibility to run the response to it. That's your one job from that point forward and it's nobody else's job.
  • Emmons, Alex: Amid Critical Supply Shortage, FEMA Is Spending Millions to Protect Trump Properties, The Intercept, 04.04.2020.
    Quote: Although federal officials have known of the shortages [in N95 mask and ventilators] for months, they have not been remedied. Yet every year since 2017, Congress has directed FEMA to set aside $41 million of its budget to offset the extraordinary costs of providing security for President Donald Trump’s properties. The “Presidential Residence Assistant Protection Grants” were most recently funded by Congress in an appropriations package in December.
  • Brown, Matthew: Fact check: Did the Obama administration deplete the federal stockpile of N95 masks?, USA Today, 04.04.2020.
    The article presents the following conclusion: There is no indication that the Obama administration took significant steps to replenish the supply of N95 masks in the Strategic National Stockpile after it was depleted from repeated crises. Calls for action came from experts at the time concerned for the country’s ability to respond to future serious pandemics. It does not mention that Republicans blocked funding for a pandemic response.
  • Coyne, Marley: This See-Through Mask Lets The Deaf Communicate While Staying Safe, Forbes, 04.04.2020.

5 April 2020

  • Desai, Radhika: De onverwachte afrekening: coronavirus en kapitalisme, LAVA, 05.04.2020.
    Translation of the article The Unexpected Reckoning: Coronavirus and Capitalism, Canadian Dimension, 17.03.2020.
    Radhika Desai is professor at the department for political studies at the University of Manitoba.
    Quote: The present pandemic is certain to be different not because it is more lethal than previous ones (it is not), nor because it is causing havoc in financial markets (as most crises of neoliberal era have), but because it is exposing the weaknesses, distortions and imbalances of the productive apparatus that neoliberalism has shaped over four decades.
  • Schraer, Rachel; Lawrie, Eleanor: Coronavirus: Scientists brand 5G claims 'complete rubbish', BBC News, 05.04.2020.
    According to Dr Simon Clarke (University of Reading), Radio waves can disrupt your physiology as they heat you up, meaning your immune system can't function. But [the energy levels from] 5G radio waves are tiny and they are nowhere near strong enough to affect the immune system. There have been lots of studies on this.
  • Natasha Daly / @natashaldaly, Twitter, 05.04.2020: BREAKING: A tiger at the Bronx Zoo has tested positive for Covid-19. 6 other tigers and lions at the zoo are also showing symptoms. Believed to have been infected by an asymptomatic zoo worker. All doing well. To my knowledge, this is the first animal to test positive in the U.S. (Beginning of a thread. Natasha Daly is staff writer at National Geographic.)
  • I have the coronavirus. This is my story. (Canguro English on YouTube, 11 minutes, 05.04.2020).

6 April 2020

  • Foley, Katherine Ellen: How to read coronavirus news like a science writer, Quartz, 06.04.2020.
  • Une infirmière montre comment le virus peut se répandre même avec des gants (BFMTV, 06.04.2020).
    A nurse explains why wearing gloves does not protect you if you don't wash your hands all the time by demonstrating how easily cross-contamination happens. The video is in English with French subtitles.
  • Advice on the use of masks in the context of COVID-19, World Health Organization, 06.04.2020.
    Description: This document provides advice on the use of masks in communities, during home care, and in health care settings in areas that have reported cases of COVID-19. It is intended for individuals in the community, public health and infection prevention and control (IPC) professionals, health care managers, health care workers (HCWs), and community health workers. This updated version includes a section on Advice to decision makers on the use of masks for healthy people in community settings.
  • Okun, Alanna: Everything you need to know about making your own face mask, Vox, 06.04.2020.
  • Chirurgische Gesichtsmasken halten Coronaviren zurück, aerzteblatt.de, 06.04.2020.
    Quote: Chirurgische Gesichtsmasken können Coronaviren offenbar effektiver zurückhalten als Grippe- und Rhinoviren. Dies zeigen Laborversuche in Nature Medicine (2020; DOI: 10.1038/s41591-020-0843-2), die vor der aktuellen SARS-CoV-2-Pandemie an Personen durchgeführt wurden, von denen einige mit saisonalen Coronaviren infiziert waren.

  • Lemaître, Frédéric: « Il ne faut pas diffuser cette information au public » : l’échec du système de détection chinois face au coronavirus, Le Monde, 06.04.2020 (paywalled article).
  • Warum verdrängt Corona alle anderen Themen? SWR Aktuell, 06.04.2020.
  • COVID-19-Hackathons: Nur Freie Software ermöglicht globale Lösungen, OSB Alliance, 09.04.2020.
    See also #WirVsVirus, #EUVsVirus Pan-European Hackathon, The Global Hack.
  • Guilhot, Nicolas: Why pandemics are the perfect environment for conspiracy theories to flourish, The Conversation, 06.04.2020 (Creative Commons).

7 April 2020

  • Chen, Stephen: Coronavirus: low antibody levels raise questions about reinfection risk, Soutch China Morning Post, 07.04.2020.
    Quote: A team from Fudan University analysed blood samples from 175 patients discharged from the Shanghai Public Health Clinical Centre and found that nearly a third had unexpectedly low levels of antibodies.
    In some cases, antibodies could not be detected at all.
    Eric Feigl-Ding's reaction: This is very worrisome. (…) However, Rajiv Pandit / @rajiv_pandit replied to him: No, not concerning. Only the covid-19 surface spiked protein was tested, which is unreliable. The more reliable nucleocapsid protein wasn’t. And u didn’t link the original submission, just a reporter’s interpretation. Here u go, but it’s only an abstract. See the article Neutralizing antibody responses to SARS-CoV-2 in a COVID-19 recovered patient cohort and their implications on the preprint server medRxiv.
  • Kelion, Leo: Coronavirus: YouTube tightens rules after David Icke 5G interview, BBC, 07.04.2020.
    See also Brian Rose's reaction on YouTube: London Real is Front Page News On The BBC & Banned on YouTube For “Conspiracy Theorist” David Icke (London Real on YouTube, 10 minutes, 07.04.2020.
  • Levey, Noam M.: Hospitals say feds are seizing masks and other coronavirus supplies without a word, Los Angeles Times, 07.04.2020.
    Quote: Hospital and clinic officials in seven states described the seizures in interviews over the past week. The Federal Emergency Management Agency is not publicly reporting the acquisitions, despite the outlay of millions of dollars of taxpayer money, nor has the administration detailed how it decides which supplies to seize and where to reroute them.
  • Rice, Susan E.: Trump Is the Wartime President We Have (Not the One We Need), New York Times, 07.04.2020.
    See also the interview by MSNBC: Amb. Rice: The Trump WH Received Many Warnings | Morning Joe (MSNBC on YouTube, 10 minutes, 09.04.2020).
  • Corona-Tracking: Wie viel Google über Ihren Standort weiß - und wie Sie es deaktivieren, Chip, 07.04.2020.
  • Adams, Sophia: oronavirus: Banken schließen Filialen - Ist das Abheben von Bargeld weiterhin möglich?, Merkur, 07.04.2020.
  • Brainard, Julii; Hunter, Paul: Coronavirus face masks Q&A: is the advice changing?, The Conversation, 07.04.2020 (Creative Commons).
    Wearing a disposable surgical masks can help prevent a viral infection if used correctly. However, many people don't wear them as instructed. Mass buying of surgical masks has caused a shortage for healthcare professionals.
    Because of evidence that wearing masks reduced the risk of infecting other people, some countries have changed their minds and no longer recommend against wearing them. Based on current evidence, the use of face masks more widely by the public is justified. Wearing masks in public is most beneficial in situations where you can’t properly keep your distance from other people.
    There is little evidence that cloth masks protect against a respiratory infection; this is due to the large pores that allow most air circulation. Social distancing and frequent hand washing remain the best ways to prevent viruses spreading between you and other people.
  • Trump Installs Ejection Seats Throughout Press Briefing Room, The Babylon Bee, 07.04.2020.
  • Basically Quarantine Home Workouts (Back Guy on YouTube, 3 minutes, 07.04.2020).

8 April 2020

  • Coronavirus : pourquoi l’épidémie va survivre au confinement #LesDécodeurs, (Le Monde on YouTube, 11 minutes, 08.04.2020).
    This video discusses several issues, especially why social distancing does not end the epidemic, since that requires immunity. However, a vaccine is still at least 18 months away from now and researchers don't know yet how long immunity lasts in people who have recovered from Covid-19. The video discusses various models for the Covid-19 pandemic.
  • Coronavirus: guidance to governments on respecting human rights, democracy and the rule of law, Council of Europe, 08.04.2020.
    Quote: The toolkit is designed to help ensure that measures taken by member states during the current crisis remain proportional to the threat posed by the spread of the virus and are limited in time.
  • Cohen, Jon: ‘We will have many body bags.’ WHO chief responds to Trump’s criticisms, Science, 08.04.2020.
  • Servick, Kelly: For survivors of severe COVID-19, beating the virus is just the beginning, Science, 08.04.2020.
  • Margolin, Josh; Meek, James Gordon: Intelligence report warned of coronavirus crisis as early as November: Sources, GMA / ABC News, 08.04.2020.
    Quote: Concerns about what is now known to be the novel coronavirus pandemic were detailed in a November intelligence report by the military's National Center for Medical Intelligence (NCMI), according to two officials familiar with the document’s contents.
  • The Daily Show / @TheDailyShow [Trevor Noah] on Twitter, 08.04.2020: Start of a thread containing links to newspaper articles about warnings about an upcoming pandemic dating as far back as January 2017. The last tweet in the thread quotes Donald Trump's claim from 18 March, which is proven wrong by the referenced article, that This is a very unforeseen thing.... Nobody knew there’d be a pandemic...of this proportion... Nobody would have ever thought a thing like this could have happened.
  • Brady, Jeff: Federal Support Ends For Coronavirus Testing Sites As Pandemic Peak Nears, NPR, 08.04.2020.
  • Dawkins, David: Billionaire Dyson’s 10,000 Ventilators Risk Missing Coronavirus ‘Peak Week’ In U.K. Hospitals, Forbes, 08.04.2020.
  • Brown, Lee: John Cusack is latest star to push conspiracy theory linking 5G to coronavirus, New York Post, 08.04.2020.
    Quote: Some suggest radiation from the powerful new technology weakens the immune system, making people more susceptible to the bug — while others believe it is the cause of the coronavirus.
  • Folley, Aris: Majority says Obama would handle coronavirus better than Trump, who tops Biden: poll, The Hill, 08.04.2020.
    Quote: A majority of registered voters said they think that former President Obama would do a better job at handling the coronavirus pandemic than President Trump, (…). That same group of respondents said they think that Trump is being a better leader during the outbreak than former Vice President Biden, who is the front-runner for the Democratic Party's presidential nomination.

9 April 2020

  • Le, Tung Thanh; Andreadakis, Zacharias; Kumar, Arun; Román, Raúl Gómez; Tollefsen, Stig; Saville, Melanie; Mayhew, Stephen: The COVID-19 vaccine development landscape, Nature Reviews Drug Discovery, 09.04.2020.
  • Kortekaas, Vanesa: Bill Gates urges rich countries to fund coronavirus vaccine search, Financial Times, 09.04.2020.
    See the video interview with Bill Gates.
    Quote: The UK has contributed £250m to efforts by the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovation (Cepi) to develop a Covid-19 vaccine. The Gates Foundation was one of the creators of Cepi.
    Canada, Germany and Norway are among the other countries funding Cepi’s search for a vaccine, with pledges totalling $690m.     CEPI has made an appeal for $2bn for research to develop a vaccine.
  • Oltermann, Philip; Sabbagh, Dan: German army donates 60 ventilators as UK scrambles for equipment, The Guardian, 09.04.2020.
    Quote: Germany’s army is donating 60 mobile ventilators to the UK following a call for help as the NHS races to get hold of enough life-saving equipment in the runup to the expected peak of the UK’s Covid-19 pandemic in mid-April. The NHS has around 10,000 ventilators available but needs 18,000. The UK has also received ventilators from China, the USA, Sweden and Taiwan.
  • Lerner, Sharon: Coronavirus Numbers Reflect New York City’s Deep Economic Divide, The Intercept, 09.04.2020.
    Quote: The death rate from Covid-19 for black and Latino New Yorkers is roughly twice that of white New Yorkers, according to the latest city data. The death rate among Latino New Yorkers is 22.8 for every 100,000 people. Among African Americans, it is 19.8. In contrast, 10.2 of every 100,000 white New Yorkers has died from the new coronavirus.
  • Fang, Lee; Chávez, Aída: It’s a Scandal That We Don’t Know Who Supported the Coronavirus Bailout. Help Us Find Out., The Intercept, 09.04.2020.
    Quote: The House of Representatives last month swiftly passed the CARES Act, a $2.2 trillion spending bill, one of the largest stimulus measures to date, with only three hours of debate and no recorded vote. The CARES Act includes limited safety net provisions for individuals and unprecedented corporate bailout funds for a range of industries.
  • Federal Reserve takes additional actions to provide up to $2.3 trillion in loans to support the economy, Federal Reserve Board, 09.04.2020.
    Comment in a Jim Bianco / @biancoresearch, 09.04.2020: Note, the Treasury (taxpayer) is really buying all this stuff (via SPVs), and will backstop all losses. The Fed is just providing the financing (with printed money).
    You're buying it!
  • Cox, Jeff: Federal Reserve unveils details of $2.3 trillion in programs to help support the economy, CNBC, 09.04.2020.
    Quotes: The Federal Reserve on Thursday announced a bevy of new moves aimed at getting another $2.3 trillion of financing into businesses and revenue-pinched governments.
    (…)Among the Fed’s measures were details regarding its Main Street business lending program and several other initiatives it is undertaking to backstop the reeling U.S. economy.
  • Bursztynsky, Jessica: Chamath Palihapitiya: US shouldn’t bail out hedge funds, billionaires during coronavirus pandemic, CNBC, 09.04.2020.
    Quote: The Fed earlier in the day announced a slew of new moves aimed at getting another $2.3 trillion of financing into businesses and governments, including its Main Street business lending program and market interventions. Chamath Palihapitiya said, It would be better for the Fed to have given half a million to every man, woman and child in the United States.
    See also the first section of Media Screwups: Billionaire STUNS saying let mega-rich FAIL, Noam Chomsky reacts to Bernie loss (The Hill on YouTube, 8 minutes, 11.04.2020).
    See also Host Visibly Confused by Billionaire: "Who Cares About Billionaires?" (David Pakman Show on YouTube, 9 minutes, 14.04.2020).
    Obviously, some rich people disagreed with Chamath Palihapitiya's views. See for example How Leon Cooperman responded to Chamath Palihapitiya's views on hedge fund bailouts (CNBC Television on YouTube, 8 minutes, 13.04.2020). Cooperman defends the billionaires based on the outdated concept of the “American dream”.
    (Note: 2,300,000,000,000 USD corresponds to 7,012 USD per citizen (assuming a population of 328 million.)
  • Wilkie, Christina: Pence bars top health experts Fauci and Birx from appearing on CNN, the network says, CNBC, 09.04.2020.
    Vice president Mike Pence does not allow health officials such as Dr. Deborah Birx and Dr. Anthony Fauci to appear on CNN because the television station only broadcasts the first part of the White House press briefings (typically led by Donald Trump) but not the second part, which also involves various experts and top officials.
    The White House press office has also previously rescinded the credentials of at least one CNN reporter, White House correspondent Jim Acosta in 2018. After CNN sued the White House over Acosta’s revoked pass, and the Trump administration backed down and reinstated him.
  • Vanderslott, Samantha: What impact will the COVID-19 pandemic have on anti-vaxxers?, The Conversation, 09.04.2020 (Creative Commons).
    Quote: Not long after the COVID-19 pandemic began, hopes for a vaccine were raised. Even US president, Donald Trump, a former vaccine sceptic, demanded a coronavirus vaccine, saying: “Do me a favor, speed it up, speed it up.” Misinformationi about vaccines can block vaccination campaigns. To address this risk, health authorities and governments need to quickly react to information that is false or misleading. Social media platforms are already aware of their role against COVID-19 fake news and met with government leaders early on in the crisis.
  • Ehrenkranz, Melanie: Vital Coronavirus Information Is Failing the Blind and Visually Impaired, Vice, 09.04.2020.
    A lot of information about the Covid-19 pandemic is available in charts, infographics and other data visualisations that are not accessible to blind people. (…)
  • Tooze, Adam: The Normal Economy Is Never Coming Back, Foreign Polilcy, 09.04.2020.
    See also Foreign Policy / @ForeignPolicy on Twitter, 10.04.2020: China’s slow return is an early sign that there will not be a V-shaped rebound for markets in the post-coronavirus recovery. The fight over fiscal policy is coming.
  • Schulzki-Haddouti, Christiane: Corona-Tracking-Apps mit PEPP-PT: "Entscheidend ist für uns, dass der Datenschutz gewährleistet wird", heise online, 09.04.2020.
    PEPP-PT stands for “Pan-European Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing; see the Pepp-Pt website.

10 April 2020

  • How to breathe if you have a respiratory infection like COVID-19 ( American College of Allergy, Asthma and Immunology on YouTube, 2 minutes, 10.04.2020).
  • Schumann, Florian; Lüdemann, Dagny: Kritik an Corona-Studie aus Heinsberg, Zeit, 10.04.2020.
  • Zinkant, Kathrin: Kritik und Zweifel an Studie aus Heinsberg, Süddeutsch Zeitung, 10.04.2020.
    Researchers at the university of Bonn tried to determine the level of herd immunity in the Heinsberg district, which had become a centre of Covid-19 in early March. The study claimed it had found a herd immunity of 15 percent in the municipality of Gangelt and a lower lethality than the percentage assumed by the Johns Hopkins University.
    However, there are questions about the validity of the study. In addition, the epidemiologist Gérard Krause (Helmholtz-Institut für Infektionsforschung) had said that a test to determine immunity against SARS-CoV-2 is not yet widely available. Virologist Christian Drosten pointed out that the available tests also find antibodies for the common cold, which can be caused by other coronaviruses. There are also other issues with the study. (…)
    See also Berit Uhlmann's summary on Twitter.
  • Atwood, Kylie: US ready to block Iran's requests for coronavirus aid from the IMF, officials say, CNN, 09.04.2020.
    Quote: The Trump administration is seeking to block the International Monetary Fund from providing a $5 billion emergency loan to Iran for assistance in combating the coronavirus pandemic, according to three administration officials.
  • Salvanto, Anthony; De Pinto, Jennifer; Khanna, Kabir; Backus, Fred: Views of Trump's handling of coronavirus outbreak slip again - CBS News poll, CBS News, 10.04.2020.
    Quote: Views on President Trump's handling of the outbreak response have ticked down for the second consecutive week. The president is seen doing a good job by 47%, down four points from 51% last week and 53% the prior week. Now is the first time more say he's doing a bad job than a good one.
    See also Oiver Darcy / @oliverdarcy on Twitter, 10.04.2020: CBS News poll finds that Republicans trust Trump more than the CDC for medical information

All of them are women. Some comments question the inclusion of Belgium.

13 April 2020

  • Linde, Pablo: Las muertes por coronavirus vuelven a caer: 517 en las últimas 24 horas, EL PAÍS, 13.04.2020 (11:35 CEST).
    In the last 24 hours, 517 due to Covid-19 have been reported. This is the second lowest number since 24 March, but this may be due to underreporting during the weekend. The number of new positive cases in the last 24 hours was 3477, which is the lowest number since 19 March and a bit more than a third of the number of new cases during the worst days of the epidemic. Up to 13 April, 169.496 persons have been officially reported as infected—but experts think that at least 90% of cases remain undetected— and 17.489 have died. (…)
  • Two Weeks as a New York City Nurse in the Pandemic, The Intercept, 13.04.2020.
    Also tweeted by the Intercept on 13.04.2020 with the following description: Two weeks as a New York City nurse in the coronavirus pandemic: I just can’t help but think that being a collective force of primarily women — many immigrant, many women of color ... that our lives are somehow expendable.”

    Quote: As hospitals around the world are struggling to respond to the coronavirus crisis, cybercriminals—with no conscience and empathy—are continuously targeting healthcare organizations, research facilities, and other governmental organizations with ransomware and malicious information stealers.

15 April 2020

  • Coronavirus : les masques faits maison sont-ils efficaces ? (Le Monde on YouTube, 6 minutes, 15 April, 2020).
  • Gifford, Mike: COVID-19, Digital Transformation & Accessibility, Medium, 15.04.2020.
  • “I Want an Apology”: Black Doctor Who Tests Homeless for Coronavirus Handcuffed by Miami Police (Democracy Now! on YouTube, 9 minutes, 15.04.2020).
  • Domm, Patti: Another 5 million unemployment claims could be tallied, but the job-loss trend may be peaking, CNBC, 15.04.2020.
  • Dearden, Lizzie: Coronavirus: Drug dealers ‘disguising themselves as key workers’ during UK lockdown, The Independent, 15.04.2020.
  • COVID-19: ‘Cough chamber’ shows six-feet not far enough, Neuroscience News, 15.04.2020.
    Summary provided by the site: Droplets from a cough travel at a speed of 1.2 meters per second at peak velocity. Findings reveal that there is no logical reason to suggest 6 foot of physical distance is substantial at reducing coronavirus transmission.
  • COVID-19: Exercise may protect against deadly complication, Neuroscience News, 15.04.2020.
    Summary provided by the site: Regular exercise may help prevent or reduce the severity of ARDS for those with coronavirus. A single session of exercise increases the production of a critical antioxidant, called EcSOD, helping to reduce the effects of COVID-19 infection.
  • Telefonschaltkonferenz der Bundeskanzlerin mit den Regierungschefinnen und Regierungschefs der Länder am 15. April 2020, Bundesregierung, 15.04.2020.
    Among many other things, this document states that the German federal government supports contact tracing based on the Pan-European Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing, weil es einen gesamteuropäischen Ansatz verfolgt, die Einhaltung der europäischen und deutschen Datenschutzregeln vorsieht und lediglich epidemiologisch relevante Kontakte der letzten drei Wochen anonymisiert auf dem Handy des Benutzers ohne die Erfassung des Bewegungsprofils speichert. Darüber hinaus soll der Einsatz der App auf Freiwilligkeit basieren. The document also mentions that Germany is able to perform up 650,000 PCR tests per week.
  • Slavoj Zizek — Coronavirus & the elite (The Radical Revolution on YouTube, 10 minutes, 15.04.2020).
    Description below the video: In his recent chat with Renata Ávila for DiEM25 TV, Zizek talked about the ways in which the world's elite, made up of the rich and powerful, are responding to the Coronavirus pandemic and how these reactions made signify in a crumbling of our current socioeconomic edifice.
    The full interview, entitled Slavoj Žižek in conversation with Renata Ávila: Communism or Barbarism, it's that simple, is available on the channel DIEM25 (69 minutes, 31.03.2020).
  • Busvine, Douglas: Apple-Google alliance welcomed by European coronavirus app platform, Reuters, 15.04.2020.
    Apple and Google announced that they would launch tools that would support apps that use Bluetooth in order to reduce the risk of coronavirus infections. The European PEPP-PT is a technology platform that would rely on Bluetooth-based contact tracing.
  • Lovejoy, Ben: 27 European countries likely to adopt Apple/Google contact tracing API, 9to5Mac, 15.04.2020.
  • Lee, ArLuther: Obama warned of pandemic threat in 2014, but Republicans blocked funding, The Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC), 15.04.2020.
    See also: Cousins, Farron: Republicans Have Been Blocking Pandemic Funding Since The Obama Administration, The Ring of Fire, 19.04.2020 (including 4-minute YouTube video).

16 April 2020

  • Queensland University of Technology: Indoor precautions essential to stem airborne COVID-19, Medical Xpress, 16.04.2020.
    Based on a paper by Lidia Morawska (Queensland University of Technology) and Junji Cao (Chinese Academy of Sciences) in Environment International.
  • Bill Gates und Covid-19: RNA-Impfstoffe als globale Bedrohung (Biologe Clemens Arvay) (CGArvay, 13 minutes, 16.04.2020).
    Austrian biologist Clemens Garvay is concerned about the push urged by Bill Gates to shorten the normal vaccine development and testing process from five years to 18 months. (The description below the video lists many references and sources.)
  • Smith, David: Trump halts World Health Organization funding over coronavirus 'failure', The Guardian, 16.04.2020.
    Quote: The US president said funding would be on hold for 60 to 90 days pending a review of the WHO’s warnings about the coronavirus and China. He accused the global body of “severely mismanaging and covering up” the threat, even though it declared a public health emergency on 30 January – after which he continued to hold rallies, play golf and compare the coronavirus to the common flu.
  • "Pure Baloney": Zoologist Debunks Trump's COVID-19 Origin Theory, Explains Animal-Human Transmission (Democracy Now! on YouTube, 20 minutes, 16.04.2020).
    This is an interview with Peter Daszak.
  • Briegleb, Volker: Kommentar: Corona-App? Danke, aber wir sind erwachsen, heise online, 16.04.2020.
    Briegleb questions the usefulness of an app that meets the European Union's GDPR, that is only used on a voluntary basis, that does not provide a reliable estimation of the actual risk of infection (because data protection hides the most relevant information) and that claims to increase protection for elderly people, a third of whom don't' even own a smartphone. An app that provides the desired protection is only feasible under “Chinese conditions”. The debates about the app are above all an example of Silicon Valley Solutionism.
  • Pas-de-Calais. L’équivalent d’un million d’euros de cocaïne caché dans une cargaison de masques contre le coronavirus, Ouest France, 16.04.2020.
    The British Border Force caught a van driver who was trying to smuggle 14 kilos of cocain hidden inside a face mask shipment. The driver was trying to get through the Channel tunnel to get the drugs to the UK.
  • The editors: Trump Is Right about the WHO, National Review, 16.04.2020.
    The authors agree with Donald Trump's criticism that the WHO took the information of the Chinese government at face value instead of taking appropriate action in China. However, they failed to mention the praise Trump had heaped on Xi Jinping for his handling of the epidemic in China. (They had reported on this in early February: Trump Praises Xi for Handling of Coronavirus Outbreak as Death Toll Passes 600 (Zachary Evans, 07.02.2020).
  • Kellyanne Conway Goes Full Stupid During Clueless Fox Interview (The Ring of Fire on YouTube, 5 minutes, 16.04.2020).
    Kellyanne Conway said, Some of the scientists and doctors say that there could be other strains later on. This could come back in the fall in a limited way. This is Covid-19, not Covid-1, folks. So you would think that people in charge of the World Health Organization, facts and figures, would be on top of that. She seemed to think that the current pandemic is the 19th Covid epidemic.
  • Supermarket boss ‘disgusted’ by toilet paper hoarder seeking a refund (Sky News Australia on YouTube, 4 minutes, 16.04.2020).
    Director John-Paul Drake of Drakes Supermarkets says that many people bought products that they will probably never use or eat. For example, they sold eight months of toilet paper in four weeks and a year's supply of flour in nine days. One customer was so brazen to ask for a refund for 150 packets of 32-pack toilet paper ad 150 units of 1 liter sanitizer. eBay also shut down that customer's eBay site.
  • Mareice Kaiser / @Mareicares, Twitter, 16.04.2020: Was machen eigentlich Eltern, die nicht mehr können? Ich frage für, nun ja, fast alle, die ich so kenne.: start of a thread about the challenges and exhaustion caused by taking care of children during the lockdown.
  • Future of Privacy Forum compares Covid-19 mobile apps, Irish Times, 16.04.2020.
    The Future of Privacy Forum examined six apps and SDKs: K Health (US), HaMagen (Israel), TraceTogether (Singapore), Covid Symptom Tracker (UK), Home Quarantine (Poland), and Pan-European Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (PEPP-PT) (EU). The report, Privacy & Pandemics: The Role of Mobile Apps (Chart) can be downloaded from the Freedom of Privacy Forum's website.
  • « On ne sait pas » : après les Etats-Unis et le Royaume-Uni, la France émet des doutes sur la gestion du coronavirus par la Chine, Le Monde, 16.04.2020.
  • Strom, Marcus: Statement from Prof Edward Holmes on the SARS-CoV-2 virus, The University of Sydney, 16.04.2020.
  • Lents, Nathan H.: I'm 41, Healthy, and Fit. And COVID-19 Still Got Me., Psychology Today blog, 16.04.2020.
  • Without providing a verifiable source Edgar Morin tweeted the following claim (16.04.2020): Le coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 responsable de la pandémie de Covid-19 qui a déjà fait plus de 120 000 morts dans le monde serait un virus , sorti accidentellement d'un laboratoire chinois cherchant un vaccin contre le SIDA selon le professeur Montagnier prix Nobel de médecine en2008.
  • CONTINUE LOCKDOWN? FT. LORD of the RINGS (LOTR Voice Impressions Dub) (Charlie Hopkinson on YouTube, 4 minutes, 16.04.2020).

17 April 2020

  • Kobeissi, Nadim: An Investigation Into PEPP-PT, Nadim Kobeissi.
    The author is a researcher in applied cryptography and is investigating how PEPP-PT works and how is behind it. The article will be updated regularly; on 17 April in contained the following conclusion: Until the above is accomplished, I strongly discourage anyone from associating with PEPP-PT. Furthermore, I ask all European partners to PEPP-PT to justify their participation in such an opaque and unilaterally-led effort, which appears to be disavowing public standards for solving urgent public problems. This request applies particularly strongly to European academic and public institutions, such as CISPA, EPFL, ETH Zurich, INRIA, KU Leuven, and others.
  • Ritter, Johannes: Wie immun sind wir? Roche liefert Corona-Massentest, Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 17.04.2020.
  • Seehoff, Michael Maria: Kein Widerstand – nirgends?, Die Anstifter, 17.04.2020.
  • Berrod, Frédérique; Bruyas, Pierrick: European Union: are borders the antidote to the Covid-19 pandemic?, The Conversation, 17.04.2020.
  • “Baghdad Don”: Trump Blasted For Most Inept Response To “Any Crisis In History”, (MSBNC on YouTube, minutes, 17.04.2020).
    Communications stragest and former Republican Steve Schmidt said, I think the White House has done historically very poorly in this. This is one of the most significant crises in American history, it's certainly the largest American crisis of our lifetimes and it's been the most inept response by the executive, by the president, I think, with regard regard to any crisis in American history, but certainly any crisis in our lfetimes. And we look at a president who is so clearly in over his head and out of his depth, who has been dishonest, who has been imprecise, who has been inaccurate and whose deadly indecision will be paid for with the lives of tens of thousands of Americans, as this virus escalated to a place it never need have gotten. And that is all because of the ways the month of February, where the president was hate-tweeting, firing people that he was angry with over impeachment, going on campaign rallies and golfing. And now the country is paying the price for that. (…)
  • Hummel, Klaas: ‘De bevolking moet na 28 april massaal in opstand komen tegen dit beleid’, Quote, 17.04.2020.
    Dutch real estate tycoon Klaas Hummel argues that 97% of Covid-19-related mortality occurs in the age group over sixty among people who have pre-existing health conditions, and that therefore, it is unreasonable to keep the rest of the Dutch population in isolation, especially since the development of a vaccine will take another one or two years. Hummel says, De bevolking moet na 28 april massaal in opstand komen tegen dit beleid. Niet door ongehoorzaamheid maar door protest. Ik ben enorm teleurgesteld hoe de media kritiekloos dit beleid accepteren en volledig focussen op het individuele leed van de Covid 19 pandemie. Er is iets veel ergers gaande. De pandemie van een wereldwijd instortend economisch en sociaal stelsel als dit voortduurt.
  • Thomas, Vincy: 11 livres, publiés ou à paraître, sur le coronavirus, Livres Hebdo, 17.04.2020.
    The list includes the French translation of Paolo Giordano essay Nel contagio, which was published by Einaudi in March 2020.

18 April 2020

  • Gravitas: Wuhan raises its death toll by 50% | Coronavirus Outbreak (WION on YouTube, 4 minutes, 18.04.2020).
    In addition to the most recent Chinese revision of the Covid-19 death toll, this video also discusses other contradictions and data that suggest that the Chinese authorities have been lying about the extent of the epidemic all along. (The WION channel from India is always very critical of China.)
  • Jared Kushner's Business Is Still Evicting Tenants During Pandemic (The Ring of Fire on YouTube, 4 minutes, 18.04.2020).
  • Xihong Lin / @XihongLin on Twitter, 18.04.2020: Very pleased to report that our JAMA paper on public health interventions with the epidemiology of the COVID-19 outbreak in Wuhan based on analysis of 32,000+ lab-confirmed COVID-19 cases in Wuhan till Mar 8 appeared on April 10. See below for a summary. This is a Twitter thread summarising findings from the following paper:
    Pan, An; Liu, Li; Wang, Chaolong; et al: Association of Public Health Interventions With the Epidemiology of the COVID-19 Outbreak in Wuhan, China, JAMA, 10.04.2020. (You need to create a free personal account to download the PDF version of the paper.)
  • Rex Chapman, Twitter, 18.04.2020: Most incredible thing you’ll see today.
    These two women are playing tennis from rooftop to rooftop in the Italian city of Liguria to pass time during the pandemic.

  • Reuning, Arndt: COVID-19 ein Fall für Neurologie - Coronavirus greift möglicherweise auch Nerven und Gehirn an, Deutschlandfunk, 21.04.2020.
  • Juan González: “Make No Mistake: This Country Is Edging Closer to Neo-Fascist Authoritarianism” (Democracy Now! on YouTube, 10 minutes, 21.04.2020).
    Among other things, Juan González says suspected Covid-19 cases are not tested in hospitals in Puerto Rico unless the hospital plans to admit them, that hydroxychloroquine is routinely administered to patients without telling them in advance that this is part of a test (but only when asked about it), and that the protests against shutdown in some states where white extremists go on the streets with automatic rifles would elicit a very different response if those protesters were African Americans. He is concerned that this this will become normalised in the months leading up to the presidential elections.
  • Brigham, Bob: Study finds people who watched Sean Hannity were more likely to die from COVID-19, Raw Story, 21.04.2020.
  • Whyte, Liz Essley: Federal documents: more than 300,000 likely to die if restrictions are lifted, Center for Public Integrity, 21.04.2020.
    See also: Farron Cousins: Trump Administration Secretly Admitted Thousands Will Die If We Reopen Country Now, The Ring of Fire, 22.04.2020.

22 April 2020

  • What face masks actually do against coronavirus (Vox on YouTube, 8 minutes, 22.04.2020).
    This video points out that masks are part of protection triangle that consists of social distancing, frequent handwashing and facemasks. They help keep in many of the germs when a person coughs or sneezes.
  • Was tun die Bundesländer? Deutschland, einig Maskenland, Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 22.04.2020.
  • Walters, Greg: Trump's Golf Courses Could Get a Bailout if the Golf Lobby Has Its Way, Vice, 22.04.2020.
    See also Trump’s Golf Courses Are About To Get A MASSIVE Bailout by Farron Cousins (The Ring of Fire, 26.04.2020).
  • Maxouris, Christina; Sutton, Joe: Missouri is suing China over coronavirus impacts saying the country did 'little to stop the spread of the disease', CNN, 22.04.2020.
  • Lowry, Bryan; Rosen, Caitlyn: Missouri sues China in federal court, alleging responsibility for COVID-19 pandemic, The Kansas City Star, 22.04.2020.
  • Cousins, Farron: Trump Tries To Shield Corporations From Lawsuits If Their Employees Get Infected, The Ring of Fire, 22.04.2020.
    Quote: Donald Trump is considering granting legal liability waivers to companies who decide to open up for business in the middle of the pandemic. These waivers would shield the companies from any kind of lawsuits if employees get sick at work and decide to hold the company accountable for this.
  • Merlan, Anna: The Coronavirus Truthers Don't Believe in Public Health, Vice, 22.04.2020.
  • Schultz, Teri: Why Belgium's Death Rate Is So High: It Counts Lots Of Suspected COVID-19 Cases, NPR, 22.04.2020.
    Quote: Belgium has surged to the top of the grim leaderboard because authorities decided to be radically transparent, if perhaps a bit speculative, about the toll from the novel coronavirus. They include not only deaths that are confirmed to be virus-related, but even those suspected of being linked, whether the victim was tested or not. See also Danis Ducarme's tweet, 21.04.2020: «Notre méthode de comptage est la plus exhaustive possible. Quand @realDonaldTrump procède à un classement macabre en pointant du doigt la Belgique pour donner l’impression que tout va bien aux USA, je trouve ça ignoble,le niveau zéro de la politique» @Le_Bux @LesNews24 #COVID19
  • Corona-Krise: Überall fehlen Atemschutzmasken, ZDF heute, 22.04.2020.

    This is an interview with the Austrian biologist Clemens Arvay.

23 April 2020

  • Will 60% Get Coronavirus? (Pindex on YouTube, 11 minutes, 23.04.2020).
    This video, voiced by Stephen Fry, was created by Pinfact.
  • Maskenpflicht: Warum wir Masken tragen und was wir dabei falsch machen können | Possoch klärt (BR24 on YouTube, 6 minutes, 23.04.2020).
  • Bialdiga, Kirsten; Plück, Maximilan; Quadbeck, Eva: Kritik an bundesweiter Maskenpflicht: Weltärztepräsident Montgomery hält Pflicht für Tücher und Schals für „lächerlich“, Rheinische Post, 23.04.2020.
    Quote: Ärztepräsident Montgomery stellte die Sinnhaftigkeit der Maßnahme infrage: „Wer eine Maske trägt, wähnt sich sicher, er vergisst den allein entscheidenden Mindestabstand.“ Bei unsachgemäßem Gebrauch könnten Masken sogar gefährlich werden. Im Stoff konzentriere sich das Virus, beim Abnehmen berühre man die Gesichtshaut, schneller könne man sich kaum infizieren.
  • Ansteckungsgefahr: Weltärztepräsident kritisiert Maskenpflicht, Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 23.04.2020.
    Quote: „Wer eine Maske trägt, wähnt sich sicher, er vergisst den allein entscheidenden Mindestabstand“, sagte Montgomery der Düsseldorfer „Rheinischen Post“. Bei unsachgemäßem Gebrauch könnten Masken gefährlich werden. Those masks that really help are needed for medical professionals. Scarfs and self-made masks don't provide insufficient protection and can even lead wearers to infect themselves, for example when taking off the masks.
    Note that these comments say nothing about the ability of facemasks to reduce the risk of infecting other people.
  • Gates, Bill: The first modern pandemic, GatesNotes, 23.04.2020 (24-minute read; also available as PDF).
  • Hoffower, Hillary: America's billionaires have become even richer since Donald Trump became president, and it says a lot about the country's record-high wealth gap, Business Insider, 23.04.2020.
    See also: Farron Cousins: As Workers Suffer, Billionaires Have Become Richer Than Ever Under Trump, The Ring of Fire, 26.04.2020.

25 April 2020

  • Löfgren, Emma: 'We're working day and night to save jobs in Sweden... but we can't make guarantees', The Local, 25.04.2020.
    Quote: It may take months or even years before life in Sweden can fully return to normal after the coronavirus crisis, Deputy Prime Minister Isabella Lövin tells The Local.
    (…) The biggest myth and misconception is that life goes on as normal in Sweden. It absolutely does not. We have seen Easter travel decrease by 90 percent, we have businesses going bankrupt, a record number of temporary layoffs, and a lot of unemployed people.
    That's because people follow those recommendations we issue. The tourism industry has been hit incredibly hard. A lot of small businesses are on their knees because production is down or has decreased a lot. It is not business as usual in Sweden but the opposite, things are very, very tough. (…)

27 April 2020

  • Klein, Ezra: Bill Gates’s vision for life beyond the coronavirus, Vox, 27.04.2020.
  • Has The Coronavirus Crisis Softened Hamas? (The Real News Network on YouTube, 12 minutes, 27.04.2020).

28 April 2020

  • Rush, Sharron: Accessibility must be part of your COVID-19 response, Knowbility blog, 28.04.2020.
  • Guterl, Fred: Dr. Fauci Backed Controversial Wuhan Lab with U.S. Dollars for Risky Coronavirus Research, Newsweek, 28.04.2020.
    In 2019, the National Institutes of Health committed $3.7 million over six years for research that included some gain-of-function work. Gain-of-function research involves manipulating viruses in the lab to explore their potential for infecting humans.
    U.S. intelligence, after originally asserting that the coronavirus had occurred naturally, conceded last month that the pandemic may have originated in a leak from the Wuhan lab. (At this point most scientists say it's possible—but not likely—that the pandemic virus was engineered or manipulated.)

29 April 2020

  • Talk Spezial mit Prof. Dr. Sucharit Bhakdi: Corona-Wahn ohne Ende?, Servus TV, 29.04.2020.
    Description below the video: „Sinnlos“ und „selbstzerstörerisch“ - so bezeichnet der renommierte Wissenschaftler Sucharit Bhakdi die Maßnahmen gegen die Ausbreitung des Coronavirus. Seine Bedenken vertritt er in einem offenen Brief an die deutsche Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel. Für diese „andere“ Einschätzung der Corona-Krise wird er angefeindet und in ein Eck mit Verschwörungstheoretikern gestellt. Was kritisiert er und warum bekommt er kein Gehör? Dr. Ferdinand Wegscheider im Gespräch mit dem unbequemen Wissenschaftler.

May 2020

02 May 2020

04 May 2020

  • Jim Acosta yells at Trump that he’s been president for 3 years when he blames Obama (Brian Tyler Cohen on YouTube, 6 minutes, 04.05.2020).

05 May 2020

  • The claim: COVID-19 has a mortality rate of 1-2% (and so people shouldn’t panic)., USA Today, 05.05.2020.
    This article debungs a meme that circulated on Facebook. Quote: A 1% mortality rate “means it is 10-times more lethal than the seasonal flu,” Fauci said. “I think that’s something people can get their arms around and understand.”
    A 99% survival rate might sound promising. But when it’s scaled out to the rest of the country – all 329 million residents – a 1% survival rate takes on a different meaning.

06 May 2020

  • Trump Explodes in Tantrum Over Brutal Ad (David Pakman Show on YouTube, 10 minutes, 06.05.2020).
    The Lincoln Project ran an advertisement entitled “Mourning in America” during Tucker Carlson's program on Fox. The ad points out how many Americans have died during the Covid-19 pandemic due to Trump's poor handling of the crisis, and that Trump bailed out the big corporations but not Main Street. In response to the ad, Trump started rage tweeting on Twitter.

09 May 2020

  • Krempl, Stefan: Voss: Mit Corona-App schneller wieder reisen, ins Restaurant und ins Freibad, heise online, 09.05.2020.
    Axel Voss wants to create incentives for using the Covid-19 tracing app by giving app users privileges that non-users would not have, namely travel, and access to restaurants, cinemas, theatres and swimming pools. He is also in favour of centralised data storage at the country level, even though the German government decided to use a decentralised approach, adding that the discussion about centralised storage and data protection was too ideological.
  • Goodman, Jack: Coronavirus: Compulsory vaccines in the UK and other rumours fact-checked, BBC, 09.05.2020.

12 May 2020

  • Trump STORMS OUT of press briefing amid clash with female reporter ( Brian Tyler Cohen on YouTube, 5 minutes, 12.05.2020).
    A reporter with Asian roots asked Trump why he found being number one in testing matters so much to him when so many people are still dying. After Trump said she should ask China, the reporter asked why he said that to her specifically. After another female reporter asked Trump to let the previous reporter finish speaking, Trump ran away from the press briefing. In testing per capita however, the USA is not anywhere near the top but at number 34, just behind Belarus. (See Rate of coronavirus (COVID-19) tests performed in the most impacted countries worldwide as of May 13, 2020 (per million population) by Statista.)

26 May 2020

  • Dunn, Adrienne: Fact check: Anthony Fauci hasn't served on the board of the Clinton or Gates foundations, USA Today, 26.05.2020.
    Quotes: One Facebook post falsely claims he was on the Clinton Foundation board of directors for 20 years and now serves on the board of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. (…) The Clinton Foundation is a nonprofit organization, meaning it must file Form 990s each year to maintain its tax-exempt status. Fauci is not listed as a member of the board of directors on any of the foundation's 990 forms from 1998 to 2018, which is the most recently available document. (…) Fauci is not listed on the current Gates Foundation's Executive Leadership Team. While he has not held positions on the foundation's leadership board, a spokesperson for the foundation confirmed that from 2003-10 Fauci served on the scientific board of Grand Challenges in Global Health. (…)
  • Tereszcuk, Alexis: Fact Check: It Is NOT Illegal For Businesses To Require Customers To Wear Masks, Masks Are Not A Health Hazard, And COVID-19 Is Not A Plot To Kill Everyone, Lead Stories, 26.05.2020.

27 May 2020

  • Schenk, Maarten: Fact Check: Context of Bill Gates TED Talk Quote About Lowering Population Growth By 10 or 15 Percent With Vaccines, Lead Stories, 27.05.2020.
    See Gates' 2010 Ted Talk titled "Innovating to zero!". A quote be Bill Gates has been represented to make him say that he wanted to eliminate part of the world population. What he actually meant is that giving people better access to healthcare would reduce the tendency among poor people to have many children.

June 2020

04 June 2020

  • Morawska, Lydia; Cao, Junji: Airborne transmission of SARS-CoV-2: The world should face the reality, Environment International, Volume 139, June 2020, 105730.
    At the time when this paper was written, the WHO recommended hand washing and social distancing as main measures against the pandemic but ignored the transmission through small droplets that can travel further than a few metres.
  • Coronavirus: Face coverings to be mandatory on public transport, BBC, 04.06.2020.
    Quote: Wearing face coverings will be compulsory on public transport in England from 15 June (…).

10 June 2020

  • Schanzenbach, Diane; Pitts, Abigail: Food Insecurity Remains Elevated Across All 50 States, Institute for Policy Research, Northwestern University, 10.06.2020.
    Quote: The COVID-19 health emergency has led to a sharp economic slowdown, with soaring unemployment and spikes in need as illustrated by news reports of miles-long lines at food pantries. (…) We find that food insecurity has doubled overall, and tripled among households with children.

    16 June 2020

    • Coronavirus EXPLODES, Mostly in Trump States (David Pakman Show on YouTube, 8 minutes, 16.06.2020).
      Republicans have been trying to blame Democrats for the rise in Covid-19 infections in certain states, but Republican states are seeing spikes in infections because they were slow to impose a lockdown or quick to get out of the lockdown. There may not be a second wave in the USA because the first wave does not seem to end, especially in Republican-led states.

    25 June 2020

    • COVID-19 Airborne Transmission Tool Available, Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Sciences (CIRES) at the University of Colorado Boulder, 25.06.2020.

      Quote: The National Institutes of Health may own intellectual property that undergirds a leading coronavirus vaccine being developed by Moderna, according to documents obtained by Axios and an analysis from Public Citizen.

    • Neil Clark / @NeilClark66, Twitter, 30.07.2020, 10:14 AM: If masks were necessary for our survival as a species we would have evolved one by now. We haven’t. We have noses and mouths. We have airways. It is not natural for people to go around with face masks on in their general life. And no amount of govt propaganda can change that. https://twitter.com/EmmaRoulstone/…
      This tweet received many responses. For example, Jonny Pullen / @JonnyPullen wrote, Humans have relatively fragile bodies, but we survive everywhere on earth because our brains evolved to be able to figure out life saving solutions without relying on brute natural selection. We invented shoes, jackets, refrigeration, vaccines, and ... masks. USE YOUR BRAIN.
      A certain Shaun / @shaun_vids responded, neil do you wear shoes.
      Thomas - No filter / @Thomas_B_R responded, The logic consequence is that you reject any medical treatment. A surgery to remove your appendix is not natural. Also massive deaths in a species are natural. Wearing masks during a pandemic would hinder that but you support dying instead. Got it.
      Dr Mike Galsworthy / @mikegalsworthy found Shaun's answer hilarious.

    September 2020

    01 September 2020

    • Fact check: Dr. Fauci was not the first CEO and other false claims about biotech company Moderna, Reuters, 01.09.2020.
      People on social media have spread several false claims, i.e. that Anthony Fauci was the first CEO of Moderna, that Bill Gates and Dr. Fauci were college roomates and that George Soros was the founder of Moderna.
      Quote: Dr. Anthony Fauci obtained a medical degree from Cornell University’s Medical College in 1966, where he graduated first of his class (here). He started working at the National Institutes of Health (NIH) in 1968, as a clinical associate at the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) (…). Moderna Inc. was founded over four decades later, in 2010 in Cambridge, Massachusetts (…), by Derrick Rossi, Robert Langer, Kenneth R Chien, and venture capitalist Noubar Afeyan (…).
      Bill Gates, who is fifteen years younger than Fauci, studied at Harvard, not at Cornell University.

      This is an update about the following vaccines:
      • AZD1222, a vaccine based on a modified adenovirus, developed by AstraZeneca and the University of Oxford
      • BNT162b2, a vaccine based on modified messenger RNA (mRNA), developed by Pfizer and BioNTech
      • MRNA-1273, a vaccine based on modified messenger RNA (mRNA), developed by Moderna

    • RKI meldet erneut mehr als 11.000 Corona-Neuinfektionen in Deutschland, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 23.10.2020.

    • Habich, Irene: Pandemieausrichtung an Älteren: Was ist die Ü50-Inzidenz?, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 23.10.2020.
      One of the measures suggested by virologist Christian Drosten is the tracking of infection rates by age groups, i.e. infection rates among people over 50 versus infection rates among people younger than 50. (In Germany, the average age of corona virus deaths is 82 years of age, but it is mainly young people who test positive.) Drosten's suggestion recycles a suggestion made by Klaus Stöhr (WHO) in Die Zeit.

    31 October 2020

    • Slovakia to test entire population for coronavirus in global first, France 24, 31.10.2020.
      The population would be testing using an antigen test, which is less reliable than a PCR test but provides faster results. Participation in the testing is not mandatory but anyone who is not able to produce a negative test certificate if stopped by police could get a heavy fine.

    03 November 2020

    • Hurst, Luke: Slovakia attempts to test entire adult population for coronavirus, Euronews, 03.11.2020.
      Slovakia attempted the entire adult population of 3.6 million (out of a total population of 5.5 million) and set up some 5,000 test centres to do that. Only 1% of test subject tested positive to the antigen test used for this process.

    06 November 2020

    • Xiao, Bang: Details about China's phase 3 coronavirus vaccine trials revealed, participants say it gives them hope, ABC News, 06.11.2020.
    • Mutation in Denmark, (Dr. John Campbell on YouTube, 16 minutes, 06.11.2020).
      The SARS-Cov2 virus appears to have jumped from humans to minks in Denmark, mutated and infected humans. According to John Campbell, the Danish borders need to be closed. It is not clear whether this virus is more infectious or more dangeours, nor whether the vaccines currently being developed will be effective against this mutation.
      However, the Danish borders and Copenhagen Airport are still open. Australia, by contrast, closed its borders on 20 March 2020 and this measure turned out to be very effective.
    • Pressemitteilung: 167/2020. Karliczek: Hochschulen haben Außerordentliches in der Pandemie geleistet, Bundesministerium für Bildung und Forschung, 06.11.2020.

    12 November 2020

    • South Dakota reports all-time high for new virus cases, AP, 12.11.2020.
      Sout Dakota's Department of Health reported 2,019 positive corona tests in one day. Quote: There were about 1,893 new cases per 100,000 people over the past two weeks, according to Johns Hopkins researchers. That means that that roughly one out of every 53 people has tested positive over that period.
    • ‘Duitsland is nou ook weer geen coronawonderland’, De Volkskrant, 12.11.2020.
    • Marsh, Sarah: Cuba leads race for Latin American coronavirus vaccine, Reuters, 12.11.2020.
      Cuba’s two vaccine candidates are known as Sovereign 1 and Sovereign 2.
      Quote: Cuba has long exported vaccines to the developing world, including shots against meningitis and hepatitis B, although data on recent sales is not public.
      Late revolutionary leader Fidel Castro backed a home-grown biotech sector in the 1980s, partly so Cuba could become more self-sufficient in the face of a U.S. trade embargo. It has since become a major part of the economy.

    17 November 2020

    • Chow, Denise: What is mRNA? How Pfizer and Moderna tapped new tech to make coronavirus vaccines, NBC News, 17.11.2020.
    • Vergin, Julia: Wie sinnvoll sind Corona-Massentests?, DW, 17.11.2020.
    • Rozsa, Matthew: There's one big, important difference between Pfizer and Moderna's coronavirus vaccines, Salon, 17.11.2020.
      Both Moderna's vaccine and the vaccine by Pfizer and BioNTech, which have passed the second-to-last phase of clinical trials, are mRNA (synthetic messenger RNA) vaccines. Dr. Russell Medford explained, The current COVID-19 mRNA vaccines introduce the genetic information that enable human cells to produce a single, important SARS-Cov-2 protein, known as Spike. The vaccine's goal is to [train] the immune system to recognize Spike and thus protect the human body from SARS-Cov-2 viral infection. The Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine candidate needs to be stored at –70°C, whereas Moderna's vaccine candidate needs to be stored at –20°C and can remain stable for some time in normal refrigerators.
    • Segreto, Rossana; Deigin, Yuri: The genetic structure of SARS‐CoV‐2 does not rule out a laboratory origin, BioEssays, 17.11.2020 (Creative Commons, Open Access).
    • Long covid: Damage to multiple organs presents in young, low risk patients, The BMJ, 17.11.2020.
    • Can COVID-19 Vaccines Be Mandatory in the U.S. and Who Decides?, An Interview with Joanne Rosen, Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, 17.11.2020.

    18 November 2020

    • Hart, Benjamin: The Excellent Vaccine News Keeps on Coming, New York Magazine / Intelligencer, 18.11.2020.
      Quote: On Wednesday, Pfizer announced that it had completed its late-stage vaccine trials, and found that its vaccine is both safe and 95 percent effective.
    • Ives, Mike; Mandavilli, Apoorva: The Coronavirus Is Airborne Indoors. Why Are We Still Scrubbing Surfaces?, The New York Times, 18.11.2020 (paywalled article).
      Subtitle: Scientists who initially warned about contaminated surfaces now say that the virus spreads primarily through inhaled droplets, and that there is little to no evidence that deep cleaning mitigates the threat indoors.
    • Murdock, Mason: Which Countries Have Already Secured COVID Vaccines by Pfizer and Moderna?, Newsweek, 18.11.2020.
      The U.S.A. secured 100 million doses of Moderna's mRNA-1273 in August. Canada secured 20 million doses of Moderna's vaccine. The U.K. secured 5 million doses of Moderna's vaccine. The E.U. secured 80 million doses of Moderna's vaccine with an option of ordering another 80 million doses if it is proven safe and effective. Switzerland secured 4.5 million doses of Moderna's vaccine. Japan secured 50 million doses of Moderna's vaccine.
      The U.S.A. secured 100 million doses of Pfizer and BioNTech's BNT162b2 vaccine. Canada secured an undisclosed number of the BNT162b2 vaccine. The U.K. secured 30 million doses of BioNTech's vaccine. The E.U. secured 200 million doses of BioNTech's vaccine with an option of ordering another 100 million doses. Japan secured 120 million doses of BioNTech's vaccine. Australia secured 10 million of BioNTech's vaccine.
    • Corona-Maßnahmen — Worum es bei der Änderung des Infektionsschutzgesetzes geht, Deutschlandfunk, 18.11.2020.

      See Jodi Doering's Twitter thread from 15.11.2020: I have a night off from the hospital. As I’m on my couch with my dog I can’t help but think of the Covid patients the last few days. The ones that stick out are those who still don’t believe the virus is real. The ones who scream at you for a magic medicine and that Joe Biden is Going to ruin the USA. All while gasping for breath on 100% Vapotherm. They tell you there must be another reason they are sick. They call you names and ask why you have to wear all that “stuff” because they don’t have COViD because it’s not real. Yes. This really happens.

      In Texas, there are long lines of cars with people who want to collect food. Mitch McConnell and Nancy Pelosi agreed not to provide another stimulus package in order to prevent ordinary people from starving. Jimmy Dore calls this “peak capitalism” and does not believe that Joe Biden will help them once he becomes president.
    • Schepens, Wim: België heeft nu meer dan 15.000 coronadoden: wie zijn ze en waar komen ze vandaan?, VRT NWS, 19.11.2020.
      15,025 people Belgium have died of Corona since the beginning of the pandemic. 12,308 of them (or 80%) were over 75 years old; 7,871 (or over 50%) were over 80 years old. Only 63 of them were in the age group of 25 to 44 years old; onlh four of them were younger than 25.

    07 December 2020

    • LaFraniere, Sharon; Thomas, Katie; Weiland, Noah: Trump administration officials passed when Pfizer offered months ago to sell the U.S. more vaccine dose, The New York Times, 07.12.2020.
      Quote: Before Pfizer’s coronavirus vaccine was proved highly successful in clinical trials last month, the company offered the Trump administration the chance to lock in supplies beyond the 100 million doses the pharmaceutical maker agreed to sell the government as part of a $1.95 billion deal months ago.
      But the administration, according to people familiar with the talks, never made the deal, a choice that now raises questions about whether the United States allowed other countries to take its place in line.
    • Wallace-Wells, David: We Had the Vaccine the Whole Time, Intelligencery, 07.12.2020.
    • Hernandez, Javier C.: ‘Pure propaganda’: China pushes case that coronavirus began elsewhere, The Irish Times, 07.12.2020.
      Quote: The mild-mannered German scientist never anticipated becoming a Chinese propaganda star. But Alexander Kekulé, director of the Institute for Biosecurity Research in Halle, Germany, has been all over the state-run media in China in recent days.
    • Chini, Maïthé: ‘No clear explanation’ for Belgium’s stabilising Covid-19 infections, The Brussels Times, 07.12.2020.
      According to virologist and interfederal Covid-19 spokesperson Steven Van Gucht, “We have no exact explanation for this stabilisation yet, but we suspect that there are various elements behind it,” he said, adding that the trend is particularly notable in Flanders and the Walloon province of Luxembourg. However, the number of infections among children is increasing, probably due to reopening of schools a few weeks earlier. Based on the decrease in infections, the threshold of 800 cases per day would probably not be reached until February.
    • @yinow (Yinon Weiss), Twitter, 07.12.2010, 5:03 AM: According to National Health Foundation data, Los Angeles county ICU occupancy baseline rate is 90%, rising to 98% in flu season.
      How does it make any sense to close down businesses at 85% occupancy when 90% is the baseline?
      This is the year of total madness.       (Including a graph showing a graph displaying a baseline (92%), flu season scenario and ICU occupancy due to Covid, which is below those baselines (85%).
      A follow-up tweet includes a link to the article Hospitals Overwhelmed by Flu Patients Are Treating Them in Tents (Amanda MacMillan in Time, 18.01.2018).
      Some response tweets: @julietast2, Twitter, 07.12.2020, 5:29 AM: This ICU snapshot reflects time 2 weeks ago when we had 3k cases/day. Today 10.5k. So...you can't see how ICUs will soon be gone?
      @sir_anders (Anders Johansson), Twitter, 07.12.2020, 7:09 AM: so the logic here is that thousands or millions of Americans needs to first pass the hospitals so they can run out of capacity and let them die before initiate lockdowns or other measures? This is how one count casualties in a war...

    • Johnson, Ed; Whitley, Angus: Australia Cancels Order for CSL Vaccine as Trial Stumbles, Bloomberg, 10.12.2020.
      The government of Australia cancelled its order for 51 million doses of a Covid-19 vaccine that was being developed by CSL Ltd. and the University of Queensland. A small component of the vaccine comes from the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and some trial participants had fals positive tests for HIV. The government of Australia ordered an extra 20 million doses of the vaccine being developed by the University of Oxford and AstraZeneca and 11 million doses of the vaccine being developed by Novavax.
    • Miller, Barbara; Dalziel, Stephanie: Coronavirus vaccine trials run by UQ and CSL abandoned due to false positive HIV results, ABC News, 10.12.2020.
