    29 December 2020

    • Brinkmann, Melanie; May, Philip: Virologin zur Pandemie-Bekämpfung - "Ich fürchte, es geht nur, wenn es europaweit läuft", Deutschlandfunk, 29.12.2020.
      According to virologist Melanie Brinkmann, the current Corona measures shouldn't be relaxed until there are only 10 new infections per 100,000 people. When the r value is at roughly 0.7, new infections will go down with a factor of two per week. Under these conditions, the rate of new infections would be at 10 per 100,000 after four weeks. In addition, when the national borders are open, this works only if this effort is co-ordinated throughout Europe. Co-ordination at the level of the Europian Union will be necessary in order to avoid a third lockdown. Politicians should define an upper limit of new infections, e.g. 35 or 50 new infections per 100,000 people, and clearly communicate what measures will be taken when that upper limit is exceeded. For too long in 2020, politicians just looked on when new infections increased and did nothing. (…)
    • Wildermuth, Volkarth: Debatte über Impfstoff-Produktion - Impfstoff herstellen kann nicht jedes Chemiewerk, Deutschlandfunk, 29.12.2020.
    • Kossakovski, Fedor: What we’ve learned about how our immune system fights COVID-19, National Geographic, 29.12.2020.

    30 December 2020

    • Petralla, Nunzia: VK keurt Oxfordvaccin al goed: Waarom duurt het bij ons langer? En waarom is die goedkeuring zo belangrijk voor ons?, VRT NWS, 30.12.2020.
    • Impfstart in Deutschland - Was Sie über die Corona-Impfung wissen müssen, Deutschlandfunk, 30.12.2020.
      In Germany, the vaccination campaign started on 27 December. Vaccination is free of charge and entirely voluntary. Since there are not yet sufficient doses for the entire population, the Impfverordnung (PDF) has prioritised three groups: (1) people over 80 years old, people in nursing homes including staff, and specific categories of staff in medical facilities; (2) people aged 70 or older, people with Down syndrome, dementia or intellectual disabilities, people with organ transplants, the police and law enforcement forces, contacts of pregnant women, refugees and homeless people and people who take care of them; (3) people aged 60 or older, teachers and educators and certain other groups.
      In the first stage, vaccinations will be done only in vaccination centres. Side effects are similar to those of influenza vaccinations; there are no known long-term side effects. Herd immunity would be reached when at least 60% of the population has been vaccinated; according to the WHO estimates that 60 to 70% is required. Some virologists, however, think that herd immunity requires vaccinating 80 to 85% of the population. The vaccine should be effective against all mutations of the virus that have been detected so far.
      The currently allowed vaccine by Biontech and Pfizer requires two shots, with three to four weeks between them.
      The mRNA does not change the human genome but is broken down relatively quickly.

    02 January 2021

    • Drahl, Carmen: Aerosol expert Jose-Luis Jimenez is sounding the alarm about airborne transmission of COVID-19, Chemical & Engineering News, Volume 99, Issue 1, 02.01.2021.
      Jose-Luis Jimenez has worked nonstop, urging the US Centers for Disease Control and the World Health Organization to acknowledge that airborne aerosols play an important role in transmitting COVID-19. As of C&EN’s deadline, the WHO’s guidance still suggests a minor role for aerosols. (On 28 March 2020, the WHO tweeted: FACT: #COVID19 is NOT airborne.
      The #coronavirus is mainly transmitted through droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes or speaks. (…)

    • Bendavid, Eran; Oh, Christopher; Bhattacharya, Jay; Ioannidis, John P.A.: Assessing Mandatory Stay‐at‐Home and Business Closure Effects on the Spread of COVID‐19, European Journal of Clinical Investigation, 05.01.2021 (Open Access).
      Julia Hartley-Brewer tweeted this article on 14.01.2021 with the following message: IMPORTANT: An international study of lockdowns by Stanford University experts shows NO clear, significant beneficial effect of tougher lockdowns on the spread of Covid versus voluntary measures to cut infections.
      Lockdowns don't save lives PLEASE RETWEET!
      This led to several responses, including the following:
      Darren Roberts / @Darren081969, 14.01.2021 You keep peddling this anti-lockdown message. Apologies if I have missed it, but what exactly are you suggesting we do as an alternative? Please don't just say shield the vulnerable.
      Pedro / @RustPeter, 14.01.2021: That’s the thing, I keep asking people the question; if you was prime minister would you lift all restrictions at midnight; so far including @JuliaHB1 not one single person has committed and replied either yes or no. So obviously Boris has got it right
      Sandip Patel / @plastic2flowers, 14.01.2021: One thing sceptics don't get is that no one wants lockdown. They are blunt instruments to get the virus under control to allow the NHS to recover and crucially let Test, trace, isolate take over. This is where the government failed plus the tiered lockdown model never made sense
      Andrew Gillies / @AndrewGillies9, 14.01.2021: Based on studies I've looked at, there needs to be a bunch of variables in place in order for lockdowns to ''work'' (also including health standard of population, and trust in government). Our variables just aren't that great, so we're stuck with a flawed blunt instrument.
      eon Watson / @LeonWatson, 14.01.2021: You are clutching at straws here.
      The report says:
      - home isolation
      - travel bans
      - social distancing
      All save lives. That's basically lockdown, by the way. It is also just one report.
      Meanwhile, a vast amount of medical advice worldwide says lockdowns are needed.
      Also check the article in The Lancet Infectious Diseases from 23.12.2020.
      See also the thread by Health Nerd / @GidMK, 13.01.2021: A new paper has been published by John Ioannidis and Jay "Great Barrington Declaration" Bhattacharya on "lockdowns" as a COVID-19 preventative measure
      Let's do some twitter peer-review! 1/n
      In response to Health Nerd / @GidMK's review, Alexandru Carâp / @alexandrucarap pointed out: What I don't get is how inteligent people fail to see, or choose to turn a blind eye, that "lockdown" is not a universal set of rules applied equally in all places. Arguing against "lockdowns", or trying to find their worth, doesn't even make sense.
      See also Assessing Mandatory Stay‐at‐Home and Business Closure Effect... on PubPeer.

    • Geyer, Steven: Es mangelt nicht an Corona-Regeln, sondern an einem Plan B, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 15.01.2021.
    • Knoll, Christiane: Lockdown-Verschärfung - "Zero Covid ist ein sinnvolles Ziel", (Michael Meyer-Hermann im Gespräch mit Christiane Knoll) Deutschlandfunk, 15.01.2020.
      According to physicist Michael Meyer-Hermann, a europe-wide co-ordinated lockdown is necessary to drastically reduce the nunber of new Covid-19 infections. Due to the more infectious B-1.1.7 mutation the reproduction number R increases by 0.4 to 0.7; as a consequence, Germany would reach R = 1.5 in a few weeks. The mutation from South Africa may have a similar effect. However, the level of infectiousness for both the B-1.1.7 mutation and the mutation from South Africa are currently estimates based on increased total infection numbers. (These more infections mutations, if they manage to spread inside Germany, could then become as common as the currently dominating virus by the end of February.)
      Since the vaccination campaign prioritises the older population, especially those in care homes, who have little contact with the rest of the population, the current vaccines cannot be effective against the spread of the new mutations in the next few weeks. The most effective vaccination strategy would be to vaccinate those who have the most contacts; however, there are too few vaccination doses available to take this approach without sacrificing many elderly people. As long as we are vaccinating the elderly, the other generations need to maintain the lockdown. The current rate of infection is so high, that new mutations could spread before we notice it. It is impossible to trace the chains of infections with a rate of 50; that requires a rate of 10.
      The current lockdown is less effective than in the spring of 2020 because it is implemented less strictly. In March 2020, 38% of employees worked from compared, compared to 15% now. There is also much more mobility now than in March.
      The current policy tries to find a balance between snowballing numbers and keeping the healthcare system working. This back-and-forth to both social contacts and the economy. In Australia, by contrast, people can go to the beaches; Australia and New Zealand implemented a strategy that brought the epidemic completely under control.
    • Hope, Alan: Study: Surviving Covid reduces risk of re-infection by 83%, The Brussels Times, 15.01.2021.
      This articles is based on a study by Public Health England that looked at 20,000 health care workers, 6,600 of whom had previously been infected, and found that only 1% from that group became infected a second time. Some of them, however, carried a large viral load in the nose and throat, making it possible they could infect others, despite having no symptoms themselves.
    • Coronavirus-Variante in Brasilien - Großbritannien stoppt Einreisen aus Südamerika und Portugal, Deutschlandfunk, 15.01.2021.
    • Wurzbacher, Rolf Tod auf Rezept. Mitten in der Coronakrise und politisch gewollt machen reihenweise Krankenhäuser dicht., NachDenkSeiten, 15.01.2021.
      See also Eine bessere Versorgung ist nur mit halb so vielen Kliniken möglich (Bertelsmann Stiftung, 15.07.2019), Spahn: Mehr Mut bei Debatte um Krankenhaus-Schließungen (20.02.2020), Krankenhausschließungen gehen trotz Covid-19-Pandemie weiter (01.04.2020), Weniger Krankenhäuser nach Corona? (17.04.2020), Bundesrechnungshof kritisiert Krankenhausplanung und fordert Grundgesetzänderung (17.09.2020), Zahl der Intensivbetten in Deutschland von 1991 bis 2018 um 36 % gestiegen (07.10.2020), Krankenhäuser schließen ihre Pforten auch im Coronavirusjahr 2020 (15.10.2020), Krankenhäuser: Weitere Insolvenzen erwartet (Ärzteblatt, December 2020), Neues Bündnis Klinikrettung.de fordert sofortigen Stopp der Schließungen von Krankenhäusern (20.12.2020), Krankenhaus-Schließung mitten in der Pandemie? (22.12.2020), Krankenhäuser und Corona: „Warum muss da der Steuerzahler helfen?“ (31.12.2020), Worte der Woche: „Wer wie die deutsche Bundesregierung von Mai bis November 2020 insgesamt 20 Krankenhäuser mit komplett 3000 Betten schließt…“ (Stefan Hockertz) (06.01.2021).
    • Heiko Kunert / @HeikoKunert, Twitter, 15.01.2021: Selbst wenn ich bereits einen Impfanspruch hätte, könnte ich als blinder Mensch online keinen Termin vereinbaren, da die website der @kbv4u nicht barrierefrei ist. Das soll erst zur Jahresmitte geändert werden - siehe: https://impfterminservice.de/barrierefreiheit 1/2
      Follow-up tweet: Dann brauch ich die Website wahrscheinlich nicht mehr, sondern kann beim Hausarzt geimpft werden. Aber, @BMG_Bund, sollte ein so elementar wichtiger Service wie die Anmeldung zur Corona-Impfung nicht zwingend barrierefrei zugänglich für Menschen mit Behinderung sein? 2/2.
      The first tweet links to the Erklärung zur digitalen Barrierefreiheit des Patientenservice 116 117, which states that the following violations against BITV 2.0 still exist on the site and won't be addressed until mid-2021:
      • Fehlende Alternativtexte für Bedienelemente und Grafiken
      • Beschränkung der Bildschirmausrichtung
      • Anpassbare Textabstände
      • Kein sichtbarer Fokus
      • Fehlende Alternative für komplexe Zeigergesten
      • Hauptsprache wird nicht angegeben
      • Fehlende leichte Sprache und Gebärdensprache
    • Impfterminservice – Meine Beschwerde bei der Landesbeauftragten für digitale Barrierefreiheit (Aktualisiert), xwolf, 15.01.2021, updated on 18.01.2021.
    • Goodfellow, Maddie: People who are infected with long Covid at work should receive compensation, MPs suggest, Leading Britain's Conversation (LBC), 15.01.2021.
    • Pundir, Pallavi: India is Witnessing a Crisis of Trust in its COVID Vaccines, Vice, 15.01.2021.

    16 January 2021

    • RKI-Zahlen: In Deutschland mehr als eine Million Menschen gegen Corona geimpft, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 16.01.2021.
    • Tod nach Corona-Impfung: Rechtsmedizin sieht keinen Zusammenhang, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 16.01.2021.
    • Tapper, James: Low-paid shun Covid tests because the cost of self-isolating is too high, Prospect, 16.01.2021.
    • Gainty, Caitjan; Arnold-Forster, Agnes: Why a vaccine alone won’t put an end to the pandemic, Prospect, 16.01.2021.
      Article originally published on The Conversation: Vaccines alone aren’t enough to eradicate a virus – lessons from history (Creative Commons). Quotes: [B]ased on the history of smallpox vaccination, even the much lower bar of herd immunity will be difficult to clear if we pin so much of our hope on vaccination. In the late 1960s the WHO realised that vaccination needed to be combined with other measures: such as the introduction of heat-stable freeze-dried vaccines and the bifurcated (two-pronged) needle—with efforts such as surveillance, case finding, contact tracing, ring vaccination (controlling an outbreak by vaccinating a ring of people around each infected individual), and communication campaigns to find, track and inform affected people.
    • Fiallo, Josh: Arrest warrant issued for ex-Florida data analyst Rebekah Jones, Tampa Bay Times, 16.01.2021, updated 17.01.2021.
      Quotes: The former manager of Florida’s COVID-19 dashboard said she will turn herself in to the authorities. The state would not say what charges she faces.
      Jones once managed Florida’s COVID-19 dashboard. Then she was fired in May from her position as the geographic information system manager for the Florida Department of Health’s Division of Disease Control and Health Protection.
      She has since become an outspoken critic of the state’s handling of the coronavirus pandemic and related data.
    • Delepine, Gerard. Le vaccin Pfizer augmente-t-il le risque de contamination et de mort par Covid19 ?, , 16.01.2021, updated on 17.01.2021.
      According to this article, the number of infections and the number of deaths has increased in both Israel and the UK, two countries that started their vaccination campaign earlier than most of Europe. In France, by contrast, the number of Covid-19 deaths has gradually decreased since mid-November. The article then points out other vaccines in the recent past that caused problems: vaccines against hepatitis B, agains the human papilomavirus and against the dengue virus in the Philippines. The article does not position itself for or against vaccines in general but against the generalised adminstration of a vaccine that has not been sufficiently tested. It also cites Norway, where there were 23 deaths that may be related to Pfizer's vaccine.

      Quote: Die Terminvergabe für Corona-Schutzimpfungen erfolgt in mehreren Bundesländern über die Website www.impfterminservice.de. Hierbei handelt es sich um eine Webseite der Kassenärztlichen Bundesvereinigung (KBV). Das Problem: die Internetseite ist nicht barrierefrei. Blinde, sehbehinderte, gehörlose, motorisch eingeschränkte Menschen und Benutzer*innen mit Lernschwierigkeiten können das Angebot nicht oder nur eingeschränkt nutzen. Die KBV ist sich dieses Problems auch bewusst.

      Jean-Marie Gueullette is a doctor and a theologian. Quote: (…) on sait déjà qu’une part importante de la dangerosité de l’émergence de virus inconnus est liée à l’intensité des échanges humains, à la rapidité des voyages et à la perturbation d’équilibres écologiques. Il serait illusoire d’imaginer que la mise en œuvre de la vaccination nous dispensera de prendre en compte ces dimensions de la pandémie, de même que la découverte de médicaments efficaces sur le VIH-sida ne dispense pas d’une réflexion sur les comportements à risque.

    26 January 2021

    • When the Market Becomes Deadly: How Pressure Towards Privatisation of Health and Long⁻Term Care Put Europe on a Poor Footing for a Pandemic, Corporate Europe Observatory, 26.01.2021.
      Quote: From hospitals to care homes, the evidence is mounting that outsourcing and private provision of healthcare has significantly degraded EU member states’ capacity to deal effectively with COVID-19. The EU must reject the private sector lobbyists now whispering in its ear, and reverse course on the kind of economic governance which has accelerated healthcare liberalisation, instead putting public provision at the centre of its strategy.
    • Corona-Impfstoff von Moderna: Experten empfehlen zweite Impfung nach 28 Tagen, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 26.01.2021.
    • Lasting immunity found after recovery from COVID-19, National Institutes of Health, 26.01.2021.
    • Wedekind, Klaus: Regeln, die nicht jeder kennt: FFP2-Masken muss man richtig nutzen, n-tv.de, 26.01.2021.
      FFP2 masks should filter at least 94% of all particles. In Germany, this can be tested by DEKRA, the Institut für Arbeitsschutz der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung (IFA) and the Deutsche Gesetzliche Unfallversicherung (DGUV). Manufacturers must be able to produce a certificate.
      In Germany, certified masks get a CE number representing the testing laboratory; in addition, the packaging should also mention the European standard against which conformance was tested, i.e. EN 149:2001+A1:2009. The mask should not have an exhalation valve.
      Before 30 September 2020, there were also CPA; these do not always meet the criteria for FFP2 masks.
      The mask should be worn and handled correctly, which is often not the case. (…)
    • Johnson, Bryan A.; Xie, Xuping; Bailey, Adam L.; et al.: Loss of furin cleavage site attenuates SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis, Nature, 25.01.2021.

      Richard Hawkes tweeted this article, adding This is fascinating. Some nations have effectively beaten #COVID19 others have been soundly beaten. Japan 126m people 5k deaths. Mexico 127m, 150k deaths.
      Why? Covid’s deadliness depends on cultural differences in our willingness to follow rules.

    • Cave, Damien: One Case, Total Lockdown: Australia’s Lessons for a Pandemic World, The New York Times, 01.02.2021 (paywalled article).
    • Schaible, Jonas: Machtlosigkeit wegen Corona: Die geistig-moralischen Wände der Pandemie, Der Spiegel, 01.02.2021.
      Christian Drosten tweeted this article, quoting the following passage: "Noch immer kursiert dieses Wort »Treiber« der Pandemie, fast immer [...] mit der Behauptung, Schulen oder Fitnessstudios oder Büros seien keine Treiber der Pandemie–[...] als triebe nicht jeder, der ein hochinfektiöses Virus weitergibt, die Pandemie."
    • Ausgangssperre in Vorpommern-Greifswald gekippt: Wie reagiert die Landesregierung?, Ostsee-Zeitung, 01.01.2021.
    • Rajeev Venkayya MD / @rvenkayya, Twitter, 01.02.2021: Twitter thread about vaccine development, beginning with the following tweets:
      (…) Back in October, I said the Warp Speed timelines were extraordinarily optimistic given the inherent risks of vaccine development, manufacturing and distribution. All of those risks and others have materialized. 1/
      Much of the risk is in "scaling up" production to produce large volumes of vaccine in a facility, and “scaling out” to manufacturing partners to expand capacity. This thread is about vaccine manufacturing and the challenges we’ll continue to face. 2/
      This article from @lizszabo & colleagues is one of the few I've seen that attempts to capture the complexity and risk of manufacturing and explain why supply bottlenecks can't be resolved overnight. 3/ @SJTribble @ArthurAllen202 @JayHancock1 @KHNews
      Two things drive much of this complexity: (1) vaccines are complex biologics that are difficult to characterize the way we do most drugs; and (2) it’s hard to predict whether changes to the vaccine or manufacturing process will impact vaccine efficacy or safety. 4/
      This is why we say “the process is the product,” and avoid making significant changes to the process after Ph3 efficacy is shown. If changes are necessary, extensive testing is needed to “bridge” to the Ph3 process, and regulatory approval of those changes is necessary. 5/
      This is an area where correlates of protection can be very helpful, beyond their value in assessing “second wave” vaccines. 6/
      The tests (assays) used to characterize the vaccine are just as important as the process itself, but they are also complex. Technical hurdles to assay development or problems with assay performance can have a huge impact on manufacturing and timelines. 7/
      Biology drives more complexity. Many vaccines are made by growing viruses in cells, and when that doesn’t happen as expected, it can lead to losses in production and delayed timelines. This is an area where cell- and virus-free mRNA vaccine production has a major advantage. 8/
      For these reasons, every aspect of vaccine manufacturing is tightly controlled: raw materials, equipment, production processes, training, operating procedures etc. All of it happens under GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) regulations, and facilities are regularly inspected. 9/
      It’s estimated that 70% of manufacturing time is spent on quality control, and it’s not uncommon for issues that arise to delay the supply of vaccines to immunization programs. While these risks can go down with time and experience with a given product, they never go away. 10/
      All of these challenges carry over to manufacturing partnerships for capacity expansion. Depending on the process complexity, infrastructure, and experience of the partners (on both sides), technology transfers can take several months and carry technical and timeline risks. 11/

    02 February 2021

    • Jones, Ian; Roy, Polly: Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine candidate appears safe and effective, The Lancet, 02.02.2021.
      The vaccine Gam-COVID-Vac, also known as Sputnik V, uses a heterologous recombinant adenovirus approach using adenovirus 26 (Ad26) and adenovirus 5 (Ad5) as vectors for the expression of the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) spike protein. The use of two varying serotypes, which are given 21 days apart, is intended to overcome any pre-existing adenovirus immunity in the population.

    19 February 2021

    • Hamburger Professor sicher: „Corona kam aus einem Labor in Wuhan!“ (BILD on YouTube, 9 minutes, 19.02.2021).
      Professor Roland Wiesendanger says that the SARS-CoV-2 virus is much better adapted to humans that, for example, the SARS-Cov-1 virus that caused an outbreak in 2002–2004 without causing a pandemic. According to a journal paper, researchers at Wuhan's institute for virology experimented with SARS-CoV viruses to find out how it could be made more infectious and more dangerous for humans. This is known as gain-of-function research, which has been criticised internationally for the last 10 years, because accidents in labs can lead to outbreaks. Due to this dangerous type of research, researchers in 2012 warned against an 80% risk of a dangerous pandemic within the next ten years.
      The claim that the virus comes from bats is not false, but the lab in Wuhan possessed the biggest collection of bat viruses worldwide. The viruses come from bats that live in caves that are up to 2,000 kilometres away from Wuhan, and it is unlikely that a bat from 2,000 km away would infect people in the immediate vicinity to a virology research lab. According to an estimation in a study, the pandemic was with a probability of 99.8% caused by a lab accident and with a probability of only 0.2% caused by a zoonosis. There is no uncontrovertable evidence that the virus was created in a lab, but what we know now points into the direction of a lab accident.
      As long as gain-of-function research exists, pandemmics remain likely, whereas the research as such has not helped us to better prepare for such pandemics.
    • Danke an Prof. Dr. Roland Wiesendanger, Universität Hamburg (Der Political Channel on YouTube, 13 minutes, 19.02.2021).
      This video points to research by virologist Yan Li-Meng, who currently lives in a secret location in the USA, and others:
      • Unusual Features of the SARS-CoV-2 Genome Suggesting Sophisticated Laboratory Modification Rather Than Natural Evolution and Delineation of Its Probable Synthetic Route (Zenodo, September 2020)
      • SARS-CoV-2 Is an Unrestricted Bioweapon: A Truth Revealed through Uncovering a Large-Scale, Organized Scientific Fraud, (Zenodo, October 2020)
      It also discusses Roland Wiesendanger's findings.

    • Österreich - Verteilung von kostenlosen Corona-Schnelltests hat begonnen, Deutschlandfunk, 01.03.2021.
      Comments: Dirk-Oliver Heckmann / @DirkOHeckmann, 01.03.2021: „In Österreich hat die Verteilung kostenloser Schnelltests begonnen.
      In Deutschland sind ab heute die Friseure wieder geöffnet.“
      Die @DLFNachrichten bringen die Absurdität der #Corona-Lage mal wieder perfekt auf den Punkt...
      John Heinrich / @xjoemj, 01.03.2021: Denkwürdiger O-Ton des @DLF Nachrichtenüberblicks vom 01.03.2021:
      - In Österreich ist mit der Verteilung kostenloser Corona-Schnelltests begonnen worden
      - In Deutschland können die Menschen seit heute wieder zum Friseur gehen
      Läuft bei uns!
      Andrew Ullmann / @UllmannMdB, 01.03.2021: Österreich versus Deutschland: Dort kostenlose Schnelltests, hier: wir lassen unsere Haare pflegen.
      @Mr_Empty_hier, 01.03.2021: Israel: Impfen, Impfen, Impfen.
      England: Impfen, Impfen, Impfen.
      Österreich: Testen, Testen, Testen.
      Deutschland: Reden, Reden, Reden. Lockerungen? AstraZeneca? Schnelltests? Ne, lass nochmal darüber reden.
      Ich bin langsam müde, Deutschl. Macht es doch 1x richtig und konsequent.
      Reaktion to the previous tweet by FH Irene by Evelyn / @FerienhausIrene: Wir machen nix richtig in Ö. Inzidenzen weit über 100 (in Hermagor über 600), Schulen offen, Volksschüler ohne MNS-Pflicht. In D habt Ihr weit bessere Zahlen (heute in Ö über 2.600 Neuinfektionen - vglbare Zahl für D wäre mal 10) Disappointed face.

    • Covid-19 - Umfrage: Impfbereitschaft in Deutschland steigt deutlich, Deutschlandfunk, 01.03.2021.
      According to a survey by the French consultancy firm KekstCNC, 73% of German citizens are willing to get vaccinated. This represents an increase of 10 percentage points compared to December. In the UK 89% of citizens are willing to get vaccinated.

    • wle, kma, evg: België blijft AstraZeneca-vaccin gebruiken, geen pauze zoals in vier andere landen, Gazet van Antwerpen, 11.03.2021.
      Possibly, the injections that cause blood clots came from badge ABV5300, which, according to EMA, has been distributed in Denmark, Austria, Estonia, Iceland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg and a number of other countries, but not in Belgium. The suspension of AstraZeneca injections in Italy is due to concerns about a different badge.
      In Belgium, the AstraZeneca vaccine has been administered to 37,985 persons, with 708 reports about side effects. This represents 1.86%, which is comparable to the side effects of Moderna's vaccine (1.93%) but considerably higher than for 0.67%.
    • Fact Check-COVID-19 vaccines using mRNA do not send the immune system into ‘perpetual overdrive’ by instructing cells to create the spike protein over and over again, Reuters, 11.03.2021.
      Quote: A meme shared on social media that suggests mRNA vaccines trick the body into creating virus proteins “nonstop forever and ever” contains false information. It shows a lack of understanding of how these vaccines work.

    • "Gewichteter Risikowert": Weil widerspricht Althusmann, NDR.de, 15.03.2021.
      The value proposed by Althusmann would not be solely based on the infection rate but also take other numbers into account, such as hospital capacity, infections among older people and regional differences with regional hotspots. A spokesperson of Stephan Weil said Weil rejected the suggestion because the value of R is usually higher than 1 and the nubmer of new infections is increaseing too rapidly, even in Niedersachsen.

    17 March 2021

    • Flint, Emma: The pill has a higher risk of causing blood clots, but nobody is banning that, The Independent, 17.03.2021.
      Quotes: According to Clue, a widely used period tracker, blood clots arise from the pill in four to 16 users out of 10,000 each year. More than 10 million people have been vaccinated with the AstraZeneca jab so far, with, according to the Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA), 30 cases of thromboembolic events reported so far following administration.
      However, for those of us who’ve been presented with the “side effect” of blood clots from the pill – and yes, they refer to it as a side effect – the news doesn’t scare or surprise us. What does alarm us is the blatant medical gender bias at work.

    • Corona-Impfplan - Wer wird zuerst geimpft, wer später?, Deutschlandfunk, 18.03.2021.
      Around 4.4 million people in German have been vaccinated; almost half of them for professional reasons. The first-priority group comprises around 8.6 million persons. The second-priority group comprises people between 70 and 80 years of age, people with a higher risk of serious consequences when infected, police forces and a number of other groups. The third-priority group comprises people between 60 and 70, very obese persons and a number of other groups who are prioritise for medical reaons. People who don't belong to any of these groups won't get vaccinated before the summer.

    • Bundesweite Inzidenz steigt über 100: RKI meldet 13.733 Neuinfektionen, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 21.03.2021.
      The incidence rate (number of infections per 100.000 people per week) increased from 99.9 to 103.9. The value of R is at 1. This means that the rate of infections is increasing.
      The highest number of deaths within a single day, i.e. 1244, was reached on 14.01.2021; the highest number of infections in a day, i.e. 33,777, was reached on 18.12.2021.

      The vaccination campaign is not progressing fast enough to give every citizen the opportunity to get vaccinated by the end of the summer. When general practictioners start administering Covid-19 vaccinations, the campaign would achieve 5 million vaccinations per week by the end of April. In the first two weeks of April, general practitioners would begin using the Biontech vaccine; the Astrazeneca and Johnson & Johnson vaccines will be made available later. The Moderna vaccine would only be administered in vaccination centres. The prioritisation remains unchanged.
    • Wissenschaft und Pandemie - "Politik kann keine reine Vollzugsinstanz der Wissenschaft sein", Caspar Hirschi im Gespräch mit Michael Köhler, Deutschlandfunk, 04.04.2021.

    • Manoharan, Veenu: Why some people don’t experience vaccine side-effects, and why it’s not a problem, The Conversation, 06.04.2021 (Creative Commons).
      Quote: The vaccine clinical trials conducted by Pfizer show that 50% of the participants did not experience significant side-effects during the trial, yet 90% of the participants developed immunity against the virus. And the advice on the Moderna vaccine says that common side-effects may be experienced by one in ten people, yet the vaccine protects 95% of those who take it.
      See also the German summary at Keine Nebenwirkungen? Covid-19-Impfung wirkt trotzdem (aponet.de, 03.05.2021.

    29 April 2021

    • Thomason, Andy: Here’s a List of Colleges That Will Require Students or Employees to Be Vaccinated Against Covid-19, Live Coronavirus Updates (Chronicle of Higher Education), 29.04.2021 (paywalled blogpost).
    • Vaccinoloog Corinne Vandermeulen: "Streven naar 90 procent groepsimmuniteit in plaats van 70", hln.be, 29.04.2021.
      According to virologist Corinne Vandermeulen (KU Leuven), 90 percent of the population needs to get vaccinated to reach herd immunity. When 70% of the population has been vaccinated, the remaining 3 million people would allow the virus to continue to infect people and mutate. This may lead to the emergence of variants that vaccinated people have no immunity against.

    04 May 2021

    • Fact Check-COVID-19 vaccines are not infectious; you can’t transmit the vaccine to an unvaccinated individual, Reuters, 04.05.2021.
      Quote: Claims that COVID-19 vaccines have been designed so that recipients can transmit their inoculations have revealed misunderstandings of how these vaccines work. Vaccines against the novel coronavirus are not infectious and cannot be passed from person to person.
      The claim was initially made in a Facebook post comprising several screenshots from webpages that discuss the potential of future “self-spreading vaccines”.

    28 May 2021

    • University of Oxford to launch Pandemic Sciences Centre, University of Oxford, 28.05.2021.
    • COVID vaccine: Who in Europe is leading the race to herd immunity?, Euronews, 28.05.2021.
      The article contains a ranking based the number of administered vaccines. The UK leads with 65,660.000 followed by Germany (52.780.000), France (37.450.000) and Italy (35.800.000). This is followed by per-country charts that display (a) percentage of the population that is fully vaccinated and (b) percentage of the population that is not fully vaccinated. Malta has the highest percentage (48.5%), followed by the UK (39.9%), Hungary (37.6%), Serbia (29.1%) and Iceland (28.6%). Bigger countries are usually far behind, for example Spain (20.8%), Italy (20.4%), Poland (20.3%), Germany (19.9%), France (17.3%) and Russia (8.9%).

    June 2021

    01 June 2021

    • Farge, Emma: Is it all Greek to you? Coronavirus variants get new names, Reuters, 01.06.2021.
    • Winter, Lisa: WHO Updates the Nomenclature of SARS-CoV-2 Variants, TheScientist, 01.06.2021.
      Variants of interest (VOI) and variants of concern (VOC) will be named after letters in the Greek alphabet. B.1.1.7 (the British variant) is now known as SARS-CoV-2 Alpha variant, B.1.351 (the South African variant) is now known as SARS-CoV-2 Beta variant, P.1 (also from Brazil) is now known as SARS-CoV-2 Gamma variant and B.1.617.2 (from India) is now known as SARS-CoV-2 Delta variant.
    • Beigel, Laura: Corona-Gefahrenlage für Deutschland auf „hoch“ herabgestuft – was bedeutet das?, Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland, 01.06.2021.
    • Corona-Impfpass für Reisen und Öffnungen – Mehr Freiheiten für Geimpfte und Genesene, Deutschlandfunk, 01.06.2021.

      According to Molenberghs, Belgium is ranked fourth among thirty one European countries that are being monitored. Only Lithuania, the Netherlands and Latvia are in a worse position. (It is no clear from the interview in what regard Belgium ranks fourth in Europe: confirmed infections per 100,000 people, confirmed deaths per 100,000 people, something else?)

    05 June 2021

    • Bericht: Spahn wollte unbrauchbare Masken wohl an Bedürftige und Menschen mit Behinderung verteilen, nordbayern.de, 05.06.2021.
    • Kolly, Marie-José; Richter, Angela; Ryser, Daniel: Herr Drosten, woher kam dieses Virus?, Republik, 05.06.2021.
      Interview with the German virologist Christian Drosten, wich discusses, among other things the lab hypothesis and the furin cleavage site, the fur industry as the potential origin of the pandemic, and misconceptions about herd immunity. Drosten points out that the concept of herd immunity comes from veterinary medicine; people wrongly assume that 70% of the population will reach immunity—either through a vaccine or an infection—and the remaining 30% will then be protected. However, with SARS-CoV-2 the situation is different: Alle, die sich nicht impfen lassen, werden sich mit Sars-2 infizieren.: All those who don't get vaccinated, will get infected with Sars-2. People don't live like livestock; they travel and thereby allow viruses to spread.
      Karl Lauterbach tweeted this interview, adding, Nach wie vor faszinierend zu lesen, wie @c_drosten zu DEM Spezialisten über Coronaviren wurde. Aus meiner Sicht ist es ganz klar, dass Deutschland viel mehr Opfer in der Pandemie gehabt hätte, wenn es @c_drosten nicht gegeben hätte.
    • Spahn wollte nutzlose Masken an Bedürftige loswerden - "dreist und ohne Anstand", FOCUS Online, 05.06.2021.

      Dr. Ali Nouri / @AliNouriPhD tweeted this article on 04.07.2021 saying, Evidence for airborne SARS-COV-2 transmission between 2 people who visited same bathroom 40 min apart*
      Conclusion backed up by contact tracing, CCTV, & virus' genomic sequence.
      *Bathroom was poorly ventilated due to malfunctioning air exhaust.

    • Virologe Stürmer zur Delta-Variante, Reisen und vollen Stadien - "Disziplin der Menschen, sich an die Regeln zu halten, wird weniger", Martin Stürmer im Gespräch mit Dirk Müller, Deutschlandfunk, 29.06.2021.
    • 45.000 Zuschauer in Wembley: "Dieser Leichtsinn macht mich fassungslos", tagesschau.de, 29.06.2021.

    30 June 2021

    • KU Leuven: Second corona wave in Europe after summer 2020 mainly due to the introduction of new virus strains, India Education, 30.06.2021.

    July 2021

    02 July 2021

    • Morcinek, Martin; Wolf, Christoph: Immunschutz aus der Spritze: Alle Daten, alle Fakten zur Corona-Impfung, n-tv.de, 02.07.2021.
